The Macallan Edition No. 1 is the debut expression in the Edition Series.  This is a limited edition drawn from eight European and American oak cask styles selected for their unique characteristics.

NAME: Macallan - Edition No.1
DESCRIPTION:
Setting world records and winning awards for their structures, Macallan is at the forefront of the Scotch whisky industry.  
The Macallan Edition No. 1 is the debut expression in the Edition Series.  This is a limited edition drawn from eight European and American oak cask styles selected for their unique characteristics.

NAME: Macallan - Edition No.1
DESCRIPTION:
Setting world records and winning awards for their structures, Macallan is at the forefront of the Scotch whisky industry.  
The Macallan Edition No. 1 is the debut expression in the Edition Series.  This is a limited edition drawn from eight European and American oak cask styles selected for their unique characteristics.

NAME: Ardbeg - Kelpie (Not For Resale)
DESCRIPTION:
This "Not For Resale" version is a pre-release sample bottling of the official Feis Ile release.  A very sought after bottle for the Ardbeg collector!
This Ardbeg Kelpie was matured in casks made from virgin Black Sea oak and more traditional bourbon casks.  Bottled at 46% like the Feis Ile bottling.

NAME: Highland Park - Bicentenary Repatriation Japanese Edition 1977
DESCRIPTION:
This Highland Park Bicentenary release certainly has a great story behind it.
In 1997 it was thought to be sold out but in a warehouse, in Japan, hundreds of the bottles were discovered. 
This was re-released in 2008 and this is one of 690 bottles.

NAME: Waterford - SFO - Bannow Island, Ballykilcavan,  Ratheadon, Ballymorgan, Sheestown 1.1  + Bannow Island & Ballykilcavan 1.2
DESCRIPTION: This lot includes 7 x 70cl bottlings:

NAME: Hennessy - Paradis - Rare Cognac
DESCRIPTION: In 1979 Hennessy Paradis was created by Maurice Fillioux.  It is known for its graceful, silky flavours, voluptuous and harmonious aroma. Maurice Fillioux, a master blender at Hennessy, blended a selection of eaux-de-vie from aged casks that his grandfather had laid down, some may have been aged for up to 130 years.  It is presented in a beautiful decanter by Italian designer Ferruccio Laviani.

NAME: Macallan - 28 Year Old Master Of Malt Single Cask Series
DESCRIPTION: Distilled and Matured in the heart of Speyside, this dram came from a single bourbon Hogshead. It was bottled on the 17th of December 2018 for the award-winning single cask series by Master of Malt.

NAME: Macallan - Edition No.1
DESCRIPTION:
Setting world records and winning awards for their structures, Macallan is at the forefront of the Scotch whisky industry.  
The Macallan Edition No. 1 is the debut expression in the Edition Series.  This is a limited edition drawn from eight European and American oak cask styles selected for their unique characteristics.

NAME: Macallan - Edition No.1
DESCRIPTION:
Setting world records and winning awards for their structures, Macallan is at the forefront of the Scotch whisky industry.  
The Macallan Edition No. 1 is the debut expression in the Edition Series.  This is a limited edition drawn from eight European and American oak cask styles selected for their unique characteristics.

NAME: Macallan - 10 Year Old - Cask Strength (1L) 58.6%
DESCRIPTION:
The much loved 10 year old Macallan bottled at its cask strength - 58.6%.
Matured in Sherry Oak casks from Jerez, Spain.
The very recognisable Easter Elchie house depicted on the front of the box painted by Sara Middleton.

NAME: Aultmore - 16 Year Old Centenary Edition 1997
DESCRIPTION:
Bottled in 1997 this is a 16 year old bottling to commemorate the 100th Anniversary of Aultmore distillery.
Probably one of the rarest Aultmores you will find.
It was bottled at cask strength and shows a list of the employees working at the distillery in 1997.

NAME: Bunnahabhain - 30 Year Old New Acquaintance
DESCRIPTION:
To celebrate the new decade, the 20th year of the third millennium, Bunnahabhain introduced 'New Acquaintance', a 1988, 30 year old Bunnahabhain.  
Limited to 400 bottles and this single malt was matured in French Oak and was bottled at 45% abv. It has notes of sweet light fudge, delicate notes of soft fruit, crème brûlée and toasted honey malt. It is presented in a leather bag.
 
This is bottle number 319.

NAME: Bunnahabhain - 30 Year Old 1989  Spiorad An Dochais Feis Ile 2020
DESCRIPTION:
This 30 year old release was distilled at Bunnahabhain distillery and was bottled for the cancelled Fèis Ìle festival in 2020.
This bottling has spent most of its life maturing in a sherry cask before being transferred for a finishing period in virgin oak casks.
Said to be spicy but sweet the name Spiorad An Dochais mean spirit “Spirit of Hope” in Gaelic.
Only 200 bottles being produced.
This is bottle 046.

NAME: Glengoyne - 17 Year Old​ 1989 - Charlie's Choice
DESCRIPTION:
One of the nine bottles from the Glengoyne “Choice” series. 1st fill oloroso sherry hogshead #1231 was chosen by Charlie Morray.  Distilled on the 6th of July 1989, matured for 17 years and bottled in August 2006 by Lang Brothers.  This is one of only 279 bottles filled from the single sherry cask.

This is bottle number 240.

NAME: Ardbeg - Committee Reserve 2002
DESCRIPTION:
Ardbeg Committee released strictly for the members-only in 2002 and only 3000 bottles were released.
It is a non-age statement dram which is made up whiskies from the 1970s, 1980s and 1990s. 
These released have somewhat become increasingly popular with each release selling out almost instantly.

NAME: William Larue Weller - 2018 Release - 75cl
DESCRIPTION:
William Larue Weller 2018 annual Release.  This has most certainly been worth waiting for...
William Larue Weller, born in the 19th century was a whiskey rectifier and distiller. The distillery and company were run by another hugely famous man within the industry... Julian Van Winkle.  His nickname is of course Pappy.
This is one of approximately 17,179 bottles. They were picked from 149 barrels. This 2018 expression has been aged for 12 years and won whisky of the year 2019 in the Whisky Bible.

NAME: Glengoyne - 20 Year Old​ 1986 - Peter's Choice
DESCRIPTION: One of the nine bottles from the Glengoyne “Choice” series.  PX sherry butt #433 was chosen by Glengoyne Mashman Peter Andrew.  Distilled 14th of April 1986 and bottled in August 2006 by Lang Brothers.  This is one of only 603 bottles filled form the single cask.

NAME: Lagavulin - Feis Ile 2012
DESCRIPTION:
This was Lagavulin’s release for the 2012 Feis Ile, distilled on the 23rd February 1998 matured in Cask #1716.  It was Selected by Iain McArthur and was bottled at the natural cask strength of 55.1%.
 
Bottle 26.

NAME: Singleton Glendullan - 38 Year Old 1976 - 2014 Release
DESCRIPTION:
This bottling of 38-year-old was the first release of Singleton of Glendullan to be part of the Diageo's Special Releases.  Matured in re-fill European oak casks and bottled at 59.8%.  This is one of just 3,756 individually numbered bottles produced.
This is bottle number 0614.

NAME: St. Magdalene - 1965 - Gordon & MacPhail
DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Saint Magdalene  Linlithgow Whisky for auction
DESCRIPTION:
This is a single malt from St Magdalene Distillery which, due to unforeseen circumstances, closed in 1983.  
This particular single malt was distilled in 1965.  It was bottled at 40% abv by Gordon and MacPhail for their Connoisseurs Choice range. This bottle has a low fill level but the seal is still intact and there is no sign of leakage.

NAME: Macallan - 21 Year Old - Fine Oak
DESCRIPTION:
Macallan Fine Oak 21 Year Old was matured in both bourbon and sherry cask. 
Whisky colour is measured using a device called a tint meter or a Tintometer. It will refer to the Lovibond colour scale which is of course brown.

NAME: Whyte and Mackay - 50 Year Old 175th Anniversary 50cl
DESCRIPTION:
Released to celebrate the 175th anniversary of Whyte and Mackay in 2019, this 50 year old special bottling consists of the following -
To celebrate this special release the Glasgow blending company started and run a competition which ended up in giving away the first 1500 bottles.

NAME: Macallan - Rare Cask No. 1, 2 & 3 - 2018
DESCRIPTION: This lot includes 3 x 70cl :

NAME: Diplomatico - Single Vintage Rum 2000
DESCRIPTION: The year 2000 saw a record-breaking harvest for the sugar cane industry in Venezuela. This rum was penned to be a superb bottling and was aged in only the best single malt and bourbon casks the distillers could find for 12 years and finished in Spanish Sherry casks.

NAME: Macallan - Oscuro
DESCRIPTION: Macallan Oscuro, which is now discontinued is just a sherry lovers dream. It contains whiskies from 1987 to 1997. It was released at the high end of the 1824 series. Other bottles include the Gold, Amber, Sienna and Ruby.

NAME: Laphroaig - 30 Year Old 1985
DESCRIPTION:
Originally released around the year 2000, this is the 2016 release, this beautifully packaged Laphroig 30-year-old comes in a striking wooden presentation box.  It is an Islay gem that is becoming rarer and rarer.
Only a few releases from the distillery have been of an age older than this since its release. 
Awards include double Gold Medal at the San Francisco World Spirits Competition 2005.

NAME: Glengoyne - 30 Year Old Millennium 2000 AD
DESCRIPTION:
Glengoyne Distillery is rare distillery that has been continuously in operation since its founding in 1833 at Dumgoyne.
Unique in character and production, this Highland single malt whisky is matured in the Lowlands but ocated upon the Highland Line. For the non peat lovers among us, Glengoyne does not use peat smoke to dry their barley, but instead uses warm air.
This is a rare and collectable bottling which was to celebrate the milenium using only their finest casks. The youngest whisky in this expression is 30 Years old and there was only 2000 bottles produced.

NAME: Ardbeg - Very Young 1997-2003 Committee Release
DESCRIPTION:
Distilled in 1997, Ardbeg Very Young was released in 2003.
It is part of a series called the ‘path to peaty maturity’.
This release only used first fill casks and only 4002 bottles were produced.

NAME: Macallan - Folio 5
DESCRIPTION:
The fifth release from the highly collectable Macallan Archival Series, an iconic series that celebrates the classic advertising campaigns of the 1970s, 80s and 90s.
The Macallan Folio 5 pays homage to an advert featuring the tale of a “Luggy Bonnet” with the words “Keep this knot firmly tied”.
The sketched image recollects a scene of acquaintances at the end of a day on Speyside when one sportsman talks of a so-called “disaster”, missing the opportunity of a dram of The Macallan from the "Laird" as a result of his hat covering his ears!

NAME: Daftmill - UK Exclusive - Single Cask 2006
DESCRIPTION:
One of 234 bottles this Daftmill was filled on 12th July 2006 and matured in a single Bourbon Cask #21. It yielded 234 bottles.
One year after being granted a license this cask was laid down by the Cuthbert family on their estate.

NAME: Old Pulteney - 35 Year Old
DESCRIPTION:
The limited-edition 35-year-old was matured in American ex-bourbon and Spanish ex-sherry casks selected by Old Pulteney distillery manager Malcolm Waring and bottled without chill-filtration at 42.5% ABV.
The eye-catching detail and design of the limited edition reflect the rich maritime heritage of Old Pulteney with the wooden box featuring a porthole on the front.

NAME: Convalmore - 32 Year Old Cask Strength 1984
DESCRIPTION:
This very special bottling of Convalmore was distilled in 1984 and bottled in 2017 giving it the great age of 32 years old. Only 3972 bottles were produced at a cask strength of 48.2%.
Convalmore, founded in 1894, was eventually sold to W&P Lowrie & Co in 1904. They eventually went into partnership with James Buchanan in 1906.

NAME: Ardbeg - Supernova - Committee Release
DESCRIPTION:
2009 was the start of this great series to the Ardbeg Committee members.
This is the original Ardbeg Supernova, peated to 100 ppm.
Only 2,400 bottles were produced.

NAME: Hakushu - 18 Year Old Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION:
Hakushu 18 Year Old is part of the Suntory group. Not many people know, but at the time of writing this description, Bowmore is part of this conglomerate. 
This particular edition was released for the travel retail market only.

NAME: Macallan - 25 Year Old - 1989 Wilson & Morgan
DESCRIPTION: Distilled in 1989, this Macallan single malt was finished in Oloroso Sherry cask #1199/1225/4886/4887 before being bottled at 20 years old in 2009.  It was bottled at the strength of 46% for Wilson & Morgan as part of their barrel selection series.

NAME: Bunnahabhain - 30 Year Old New Acquaintance
DESCRIPTION:
To celebrate the new decade, the 20th year of the third millennium, Bunnahabhain introduced 'New Acquaintance', a 1988, 30 year old Bunnahabhain.  
Limited to 400 bottles and this single malt was matured in French Oak and was bottled at 45% abv. It has notes of sweet light fudge, delicate notes of soft fruit, crème brûlée and toasted honey malt. It is presented in a leather bag.
 
This is bottle number 199.

NAME: Macallan - Edition 2,3,4,5
DESCRIPTION:
This lot brings together the Macallan Edition set to date (minus 1), comprising of Edition no.2, 3 ,4 and 5 in the annual limited edition series.  
The Macallan 'Edition' series is a showcase of select casks producing a taste with their own individual characteristics.

NAME: Convalmore - 32 Year Old Cask Strength 1984
DESCRIPTION:
This very special bottling of Convalmore was distilled in 1984 and bottled in 2017 giving it the great age of 32 years old. Only 3972 bottles were produced at a cask strength of 48.2%.
Convalmore, founded in 1894, was eventually sold to W&P Lowrie & Co in 1904. They eventually went into partnership with James Buchanan in 1906.

NAME: Lagavulin - Fèis Ìle 2015
DESCRIPTION:
The Lagavulin Fèis Ìle 2015 release was a 24 year old, triple matured malt aged in bourbon casks, px sherry casks and old oak puncheons. It was bottled at the natural cask strength of 59.9%.  This was a limited release of 3500 individually bottles.
This is bottle number 2406.

NAME: Macallan - Rare Cask Black - Steven Klein
DESCRIPTION:
Released exclusively for travel retail, uniquely, Rare Cask Black has been crafted from first fill Spanish and American sherry seasoned oak casks from less than 100 casks.  This yielded 5,000 bottles of a more peated spirit.
This is the sixth release from the Macallan Masters of Photography range and adorns imagery created by Steven Klein, a US photographer whose clients have previously included the likes of Madonna, Lady Gaga and Britney Spears amidst many high profile fashion labels and magazines.

NAME: Bunnahabhain - 30 Year Old New Acquaintance
DESCRIPTION:
To celebrate the new decade, the 20th year of the third millennium, Bunnahabhain introduced 'New Acquaintance', a 1988, 30 year old Bunnahabhain.  
Limited to 400 bottles and this single malt was matured in French Oak and was bottled at 45% abv. It has notes of sweet light fudge, delicate notes of soft fruit, crème brûlée and toasted honey malt. It is presented in a leather bag.
 
Bottle 280.

NAME: Macallan - Folio 5
DESCRIPTION:
The fifth release from the highly collectable Macallan Archival Series, an iconic series that celebrates the classic advertising campaigns of the 1970s, 80s and 90s.
The Macallan Folio 5 pays homage to an advert featuring the tale of a “Luggy Bonnet” with the words Keep this knot firmly tied”.
The sketched image recollects a scene of acquaintances at the end of a day on Speyside when one sportsman talks of a so-called “disaster”, missing the opportunity of a dram of The Macallan from the "Laird" as a result of his hat covering his ears!

NAME: Macallan - Folio 5
DESCRIPTION:
The fifth release from the highly collectable Macallan Archival Series, an iconic series that celebrates the classic advertising campaigns of the 1970s, 80s and 90s.
The Macallan Folio 5 pays homage to an advert featuring the tale of a “Luggy Bonnet” with the words eep this knot firmly tied”.
The sketched image recollects a scene of acquaintances at the end of a day on Speyside when one sportsman talks of a so-called “disaster”, missing the opportunity of a dram of The Macallan from the "Laird" as a result of his hat covering his ears!

NAME: Hillside - 25 Year Old (1970) - Rare Malts 60.10%
DESCRIPTION:
This wonderful series was created by United Distillers, using bottlings from mostly closed distilleries in 1995. The single malts were distilled between the late 60’s and early 80’s maturing for at least 18 years each and some even reaching 30 years. Due to the great success of this, an annual release was formed, aptly named “Special Releases” in 2001. 
A great 25 year old at 60.1% that was distilled in 1970 from Glenesk distillery (also known as Hillside). After its closure in 1985 it was removed completly in 1997.

NAME: Highland Park - 30 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: Released in April 2005 the Highland Park 30-Year-Old is a whisky that many say is the ultimate expression of the distillery's character. Maturation in refill Sherry seasoned casks prevents oak from dominating the flavours of the whisky as it would if first-fill casks were used.  Highland Park 30-Year-Old is still an outstanding whisky that has been recognised by many international awards.

NAME: Yamazaki - 18 Year Old
DESCRIPTION:
Yamazaki 18 Year Old is an award-winning Japanese single malt from Suntory Distillery.
This bottling earned Gold at the 2007 International Spirits Challenge, and impressively it also won double gold at the 2005 San Francisco World Spirits Competition.

NAME: Caroni - 23 Year Old Full Proof Heavy The Last Caroni 1996 Velier
DESCRIPTION:
Caroni was established in 1918 and can be found in the centre of Trinidad's Caroni plains. It is a single estate distillery and possesses its own sugar plant. In the very early days they used a cast iron pot still, which in later years was replaced with a single column style still. Caroni became famous for its very distinctive heavy style of rum. A year after the distillery closed in 2004 Italian raconteur Luca Gargano headed to Trinidad and came across the derelict distillery. On a photoshoot he stumbled across a warehouse full of Caroni barrels and in the next few years the barrels were purchased.
 The distillery is now closed and this is the final release (39th). It consists of 24 barrels that have been blended together, all of which are of the heaviest calibre. This special release was bottled in 2019.

NAME: Caroni - 23 Year Old Full Proof Heavy The Last Caroni 1996 Velier
DESCRIPTION:
Caroni was established in 1918 and can be found in the centre of Trinidad's Caroni plains. It is a single estate distillery and possesses its own sugar plant. In the very early days they used a cast iron pot still, which in later years was replaced with a single column style still. Caroni became famous for its very distinctive heavy style of rum. A year after the distillery closed in 2004 Italian raconteur Luca Gargano headed to Trinidad and came across the derelict distillery. On a photoshoot he stumbled across a warehouse full of Caroni barrels and in the next few years the barrels were purchased.
 The distillery is now closed and this is the final release (39th). It consists of 24 barrels that have been blended together, all of which are of the heaviest calibre. This special release was bottled in 2019.

NAME: Macallan - 100 Queen Street
DESCRIPTION: A special presentation of Macallan given to Edrington staff members to celebrate the move of the company's headquarters from Perth to Glasgow in April 2017.  100 Queen Street, Glasgow is Macallan's new global headquarters.

NAME: Nc'nean - Ainnir Inaugural Release
DESCRIPTION:
Annabel Thomas and her family conceived the idea in 2012 for an all natural way of producing Scotch Whisky and change the way the world the Scotch Whisky Industry. Thus, Nc’nean was born and the very next year Annabel left London and her job behind to start her dream. This inspirational story gets even better with her rounds of fundraising achieving backing to the tune of £7,500,000 and the distillery build beginning in 2014. The design of the building was by a gentleman who is sadly no longer with us, Dr Jim Swan who also over saw the first spirit run in March 2017.
Pronounced nc-nee-an, this is a shortened version of a Gaelic folk legend, Queen of the Spirits, Neachneohain.
This is their inaugural release and 2020 will see all 1320 bottles of single malt whisky reach their thirsty & excited fans! A five cask vatting was chosen for this release and have been chosen by Gordon Wood, the distillery manager, Annabel and her dedicated team. It was bottled at cask strength 60.3% and the vessel of choice has been fully recycled.
The casks were as follows -
Ex-bourbon casks #128 and #130, and shaved, toasted and re-charred wine barriques #66, #92 and #120.
A truly great vision and a remarkable journey to this point from Annabel.

NAME: Macallan - Folio 5
DESCRIPTION:
The fifth release from the highly collectable Macallan Archival Series, an iconic series that celebrates the classic advertising campaigns of the 1970s, 80s and 90s.
The Macallan Folio 5 pays homage to an advert featuring the tale of a “Luggy Bonnet” with the words “Keep this knot firmly tied”.
The sketched image recollects a scene of acquaintances at the end of a day on Speyside when one sportsman talks of a so-called “disaster”, missing the opportunity of a dram of The Macallan from the "Laird" as a result of his hat covering his ears!

NAME: Yamazaki - 18 Year Old
DESCRIPTION:
Yamazaki 18 Year Old is an award-winning Japanese single malt from Suntory Distillery.
This bottling earned Gold at the 2007 International Spirits Challenge, and impressively it also won double gold at the 2005 San Francisco World Spirits Competition.

NAME: Lagavulin - Feis Ile 2014
DESCRIPTION:
Taken from European oak Sherry butts specially selected by Iain McArthur, this Fèis Ìle 2014 bottling of Lagavulin was distilled in 1995 and has been said to be one of the best festival releases of the year. This is one of 3,500 individually numbered bottles produced.
This is bottle number 1124.

NAME: Glenfiddich 2007 #25427 - Spirit of Speyside 2020
DESCRIPTION:
This is one of just 450 bottles released by Glenfiddich for the cancelled 2020 Spirit Speyside Whisky Festival. This 2007 vintage was matured in a single refill butt (Cask No. 25427) hand-selected by Malt Master Brian Kinsman. 
 
This is bottle number 326.

NAME: Bowmore - Managers Selection - 2019 Distillery Exclusive
DESCRIPTION:
This is one of only 3000 individually numbered bottles, released exclusively at Bowmore Distillery in 2019.  This limited release from the home of the legendary No. 1 Vaults, was specially selected by Distillery Manager David Turner, after being matured in first-fill Oloroso Sherry Hogsheads. 
The Bowmore Distillery Manager's Selection is a follow up to the Bowmore Craftsmen's Collection.
This is bottle number nine out of three thousand.

NAME: Macallan - Folio 5
DESCRIPTION:
The fifth release from the highly collectable Macallan Archival Series, an iconic series that celebrates the classic advertising campaigns of the 1970s, 80s and 90s.
The Macallan Folio 5 pays homage to an advert featuring the tale of a “Luggy Bonnet” with the words “Keep this knot firmly tied”.
The sketched image recollects a scene of acquaintances at the end of a day on Speyside when one sportsman talks of a so-called “disaster”, missing the opportunity of a dram of The Macallan from the "Laird" as a result of his hat covering his ears!

NAME: Caroni - 21 Year Old Full Proof Heavy Kevon 'Slippery' Moreno 1998 Velier
DESCRIPTION:
Caroni was established in 1918 and can be found in the centre of Trinidad's Caroni plains. It is a single estate distillery and possesses its own sugar plant. In the very early days they used a cast iron pot still, which in later years was replaced with a single column style still. Caroni became famous for its very distinctive heavy style of rum. A year after the distillery closed in 2004 Italian raconteur Luca Gargano headed to Trinidad and came across the derelict distillery. On a photoshoot he stumbled across a warehouse full of Caroni barrels and in the next few years the barrels were purchased.
The distillery is now closed but they have celebrated their employees in this bottling. It pays tribute to Kevon 'Slippery' Moreno for his 10 years of loyal service. 
It is one of only 1400 bottles and consists of 6 barrels.

NAME: Highland Park - 25 Year Old - 48.1%
DESCRIPTION:
This Highland Park 25-Year-Old, bottled at 48.1% ABV.
Very nicely presented with a gentle smokey finish.

NAME: Lagavulin - 21 Year Old - Jazz Festival 2019
DESCRIPTION:
A limited release from the home of Islay Jazz, Lagavulin. 2004 bottles were released and they were only available to purchase from the distillery.
Bottled at cask strength it displays a great balance between the classic Lagavulin smokiness and a refined tropical fruit flavour.
 
This is bottle number 1089.

NAME: Yamazaki - 18 Year Old
DESCRIPTION:
Yamazaki 18 Year Old is an award-winning Japanese single malt from Suntory Distillery.
This bottling earned Gold at the 2007 International Spirits Challenge, and impressively it also won double gold at the 2005 San Francisco World Spirits Competition.

NAME: Macallan - Folio 5
DESCRIPTION:
The fifth release from the highly collectable Macallan Archival Series, an iconic series that celebrates the classic advertising campaigns of the 1970s, 80s and 90s.
The Macallan Folio 5 pays homage to an advert featuring the tale of a “Luggy Bonnet” with the words “Keep this knot firmly tied”.
The sketched image recollects a scene of acquaintances at the end of a day on Speyside when one sportsman talks of a so-called “disaster”, missing the opportunity of a dram of The Macallan from the "Laird" as a result of his hat covering his ears!

NAME: Nc'nean - Ainnir Inaugural Release
DESCRIPTION:
Annabel Thomas and her family conceived the idea in 2012 for an all natural way of producing Scotch Whisky and change the way the world the Scotch Whisky Industry. Thus, Nc’nean was born and the very next year Annabel left London and her job behind to start her dream. This inspirational story gets even better with her rounds of fundraising achieving backing to the tune of £7,500,000 and the distillery build beginning in 2014. The design of the building was by a gentleman who is sadly no longer with us, Dr Jim Swan who also over saw the first spirit run in March 2017.
Pronounced nc-nee-an, this is a shortened version of a Gaelic folk legend, Queen of the Spirits, Neachneohain.
This is their inaugural release and 2020 will see all 1320 bottles of single malt whisky reach their thirsty & excited fans! A five cask vatting was chosen for this release and have been chosen by Gordon Wood, the distillery manager, Annabel and her dedicated team. It was bottled at cask strength 60.3% and the vessel of choice has been fully recycled.
The casks were as follows -
Ex-bourbon casks #128 and #130, and shaved, toasted and re-charred wine barriques #66, #92 and #120.
A truly great vision and a remarkable journey to this point from Annabel.

NAME: Chichibu - London Edition (2019)
DESCRIPTION:
The London Edition (2019) from the Chichibu Distillery in Japan was bottled at 48.5%.  It was an exclusive distillery bottling for the Whisky Show.  
This is one of 1405 individually numbered bottles.

NAME: Glendronach - Grandeur - 25 Year Old #7
DESCRIPTION:
Exclusively matured in Sherry oak casks for 25 years this beautifully presented bottle is part of the Grandeur series by the Highland distillery.
Only 1180 bottles produced making this a great item for collectors.

NAME: Ardbeg - 1974 Gordon & MacPhail - Connoisseurs Choice
DESCRIPTION:
Distilled on Islay in 1974 and bottled in 1996 this release is from Gordon and MacPhail.
This range is part of the Connoisseurs Choice range.

NAME: Tomatin - 20 Year Old 1976 - Signatory - Vlaamse Caledonische Society VZW.
DESCRIPTION:
One of just 100 bottles of 1976 Tomatin, matured in an oak cask for 20 years and bottled by Signatory for the 20th anniversary of Vlaamse Caledonische Society VZW.
This is bottle number 35.

NAME: Macallan - 18 Year Old Sherry Oak (1997)
DESCRIPTION:
This annual release of The Macallan's popular 18 Year Old Sherry Oak is matured exclusively in sherry seasoned casks, built from both Spanish and American oak, providing a beautifully dark flavour with rich aromas.
The nose opens with dried fruits, ginger and hints of citrus with vanilla and cinnamon. The palate is rich in dried fruits, spices, orange, cloves and wood smoke, before a full and lingering finish with sweet toffee, ginger and a hint of smoke.

NAME: Caol Ila - Signatory 21 Year Old - 1974 Vintage
BOTTLER: Signatory Vintage Scotch Whisky Co. Ltd.
DESCRIPTION: This Single Islay Malt Scotch Whisky was matured in an oak cask for 21 years before being bottled in Septmeber 1996.

NAME: Yamazaki - 18 Year Old
DESCRIPTION:
Yamazaki 18 Year Old is an award-winning Japanese single malt from Suntory Distillery.
This bottling earned Gold at the 2007 International Spirits Challenge, and impressively it also won double gold at the 2005 San Francisco World Spirits Competition.

NAME: Ardbeg - Corryvreckan - Committee Reserve
DESCRIPTION:
This special release of Corryvreckan was only available to Ardbeg Committee members before it was repackaged and released to the public in 2008.
This is one of a limited release of only 5000 bottles.
Corryvreckan is now one of Ardbeg's core malt range which also includes the 10-year-old & Uigeadail as well as An Oa.  Named after a whirlpool close to Ardbeg distillery, Corryvreckan is an intense dram that has risen in popularity.

NAME: Waterford - SFO - Bannow, Ballykilcavan,  Ratheadon, Ballymorgan & Sheestown 1.1
DESCRIPTION: This lot includes 5 x 70cl bottlings:

NAME: Smögen - 8 Year Old SMWS 145.1 A Sweet Kiss From A Smoking Mermaid
DESCRIPTION:
Founded in Edinburgh in 1983 by Phillip 'Pip' Hills comes The Scotch Malt Whisky Society. His passion for whisky started when he was travelling around the country in the 70s. After which, it took his little time to purchase his first cask with a group of friends. Many years later the syndicate was purchased by Glenmorangie PLC.
This Swedish distillery Smögent produced only 240 bottles of this 8 year old were produced. It was distilled on the 11th August 2011 and came from a 1st fill Ex-bourbon barrel.

NAME: Balblair - 30 Year Old SMWS 70.40 Eloquent Silence
DESCRIPTION:
Founded in Edinburgh in 1983 by Phillip 'Pip' Hills comes The Scotch Malt Whisky Society. His passion for whisky started when he was travelling around the country in the 70s. After which, it took his little time to purchase his first cask with a group of friends. Many years later the syndicate was purchased by Glenmorangie PLC.
From the Highland distillery Balblair, this dram was matured for 30 years after maturing in an refill Ex-bourbon. SMWS cask No: 70.40 and labelled Eloquent Silence.

NAME: Jura - 30 Year Old 1989 SMWS 31.37
DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Isle of Jura Whisky for auction
DESCRIPTION:
Founded in Edinburgh in 1983 by Phillip 'Pip' Hills comes The Scotch Malt Whisky Society. His passion for whisky started when he was travelling around the country in the 70s. After which, it took his little time to purchase his first cask with a group of friends. Many years later the syndicate was purchased by Glenmorangie PLC.
This 1989 vintage Jura single malt was matured for a total of 30 years. 27 years in ex-bourbon wood, and finished in a first-fill sauternes barrique.  This is one of just 232 bottles. This release was named 'Flies' cemeteries and old sea chests, bottled by SMWS at 52.2%.

NAME: Laphroaig - 17 Year Old 1989 - Fèis Ìle 2007
DESCRIPTION:
This is a 1989 vintage Laphroaig, bottled at 17 years of age. It was released for the Friends of Laphroaig for Feis Isle 2007 and to celebrate the opening of the 'Friends' lounge at the distillery.  
This is one of just 4000 bottles produced.

NAME: Benromach - 35 Year Old​
DESCRIPTION: This beautifully presented bottling comes from an era before the distillery was mothballed in 1983. The whisky world are certainly glad to see it back and thriving. This is one of their oldest whiskies on the market at the moment.

NAME: Glenmorangie - 1991 Grand Vintage - Bond House No.1 Collection
DESCRIPTION:
Aged for 26 years, the fourth release in The Glenmorangie exclusive Bond House No. 1 Collection - two rare parcels of 1991 whisky were combined that ordinarily, would never be brought together. Matured in bourbon casks, each was then finished for more than a decade – one in oloroso sherry casks for sweetness and spice, the other in burgundy casks for earthy and truffle notes.
Please note the shipping weight of this lot is 4lg.
This is bottle number 3619.

NAME: Laphroaig - 17 Year Old 1989 - Fèis Ìle 2007
DESCRIPTION:
This is a 1989 vintage Laphroaig, bottled at 17 years of age. It was released for the Friends of Laphroaig for Feis Isle 2007 and to celebrate the opening of the 'Friends' lounge at the distillery.  
This is one of just 4000 bottles produced.

NAME: Linkwood - 23 Year Old - Rare Malts (61.2%)
DESCRIPTION:
The Rare Malt Selection is a historic selection of single malt whiskies from operational and lost distilleries, all released between 1995 and 2005 Diageo.
Distilled in 1974, matured for 23 years and bottled at the natural cask strength of 61.2% for the Rare Malt Selection.

NAME: Scapa - 16 Year Old  - Jutland Memorial 100th Anniversary Edition - Single Cask
DESCRIPTION:
A special single cask bottling of Scapa, released in 2016 to commemorate the Battle of Jutland, which occurred in 1916, bottled in a tribute the 249 ships that were involved in the Battle of Jutland. This is one of 249 bottles produced.
This is bottle number 075.

NAME: Royal Lochnagar - 30 Year Old (1974) - Rare Malts 56.2%
DESCRIPTION:
This Rare Malts Selection bottling of single malt whisky from the Royal Lochnagar distillery is highly collectable. It was distilled in 1974 and bottled 30 years later in 2004, and bottled at its cask strength of 56.2% ABV.
The Rare Malts Selection was created in 1995 consisting of bottlings predominantly from closed distilleries, distilled in the late 60s, 70s or early 80s and aged for at least 18 years. The success of the range culminated in the creation of an annual Special Releases range in 2001.

NAME: Mortlach - 25 Year Old - 1982 Old &Rare - Douglas Laing
DESCRIPTION: This limited edition 1992 vintage 25-year-old Mortlach was bottled for Douglas Laing's Old and Rare 'platinum selection' series.  It was bottled at the natural cask strength of 58.8% in 2017 from a single sherry butt.  This is one of just 319 bottles produced.

NAME: Caroni - 23 Year Old 100 Proof Guyana Stock 1994 Velier
DESCRIPTION:
Caroni was established in 1918 and can be found in the centre of Trinidad's Caroni plains. It is a single estate distillery and possesses its own sugar plant. In the very early days they used a cast iron pot still, which in later years was replaced with a single column style still. Caroni became famous for its very distinctive heavy style of rum. A year after the distillery closed in 2004 Italian raconteur Luca Gargano headed to Trinidad and came across the derelict distillery. On a photoshoot he stumbled across a warehouse full of Caroni barrels and in the next few years the barrels were purchased.
This bottling was distilled in 1994 and aged in its rightful birth place of Trinidad until 2008.  The barrels we moved to DDL's Diamond distillery in Guyana. 
This bottling was selected by Velier's Luca Gargano in 2017 and is the 6th Caroni release.

NAME: Midleton - Very Rare 2000 - Irish Whiskey
DESCRIPTION:
A blend of famous whiskies released every year since 1984. Each bottle is numbered individually and signed by the master distiller Barry Crockett. 2012 was the year he decided to retire and to honour him they release Barry Crockett legacy. This whisky has been aged for a maximum of 25 years and a minimum of 12 years in Bourbon casks only.
This bottling was aged to perfection and bottled in 2000.  
This is bottle number 27791.

NAME: Macallan - 15 Year Old - Triple Cask (Fine Oak) (6 x 70cl)
DESCRIPTION:
This lot includes 6 x 70cl bottles of Macallan - 15 Year Old - Triple Cask (Fine Oak).
This 15-year-old Macallan single malt was is part of the Triple Cask range (which was brought out to replace the Fine Oak range in 2018).  This whisky has been matured for 15 years in a combination of European sherry seasoned casks, American sherry seasoned casks and American ex-bourbon casks.

NAME: Ardbeg - Corryvreckan - Committee Reserve
DESCRIPTION:
This special release of Corryvreckan was only available to Ardbeg Committee members before it was repackaged and released to the public in 2008.
This is one of a limited release of only 5000 bottles.
Corryvreckan is now one of Ardbeg's core malt range which also includes the 10-year-old & Uigeadail as well as An Oa.  Named after a whirlpool close to Ardbeg distillery, Corryvreckan is an intense dram that has risen in popularity.

NAME: Nc'nean - Ainnir Inaugural Release
DESCRIPTION:
Annabel Thomas and her family conceived the idea in 2012 for an all natural way of producing Scotch Whisky and change the way the world the Scotch Whisky Industry. Thus, Nc’nean was born and the very next year Annabel left London and her job behind to start her dream. This inspirational story gets even better with her rounds of fundraising achieving backing to the tune of £7,500,000 and the distillery build beginning in 2014. The design of the building was by a gentleman who is sadly no longer with us, Dr Jim Swan who also over saw the first spirit run in March 2017.
Pronounced nc-nee-an, this is a shortened version of a Gaelic folk legend, Queen of the Spirits, Neachneohain.

A truly great vision and a remarkable journey to this point from Annabel.

NAME: Strathisla - 36 Year Old Duncan Taylor 1967 #1329
DESCRIPTION:
An independant bottler, based in Huntly, that has produced some amazing whiskies over the years and goes by the name of Duncan Taylor. Their most common lines are Black Bull, Indian Summer, Smokin', The Octave, The Rarest, Tantalus and Rare Auld. Duncan Taylor founded in 1938 as a cask broker and trading company in Glasgow. The company built strong ties over the years with distillers and distilleries over Scotland. They eventually run their own casks to different distilleries to be filled and this resulted in a superb collection of casks from different distilleries. As it transpires, many of these are now closed. Lucky for them, their casks are maturing nicely in their warehouses! Euan Shand took over the company in 2001, who has a wide range of industry experience and has has time at Glendronach distillery, William Teacher’s & Sons, and founding/running The Bennachie Whisky Company.
This Starthisla is of great age, 36 years has been spent maturing in cask #1329. Only 166 bottles were produced and it was bottled in 2003.

NAME: Benriach - 30 Year Old SMWS 12.37 Invitation To The Promised Land
DESCRIPTION:
Founded in Edinburgh in 1983 by Phillip 'Pip' Hills comes The Scotch Malt Whisky Society. His passion for whisky started when he was travelling around the country in the 70s. After which, it took his little time to purchase his first cask with a group of friends. Many years later the syndicate was purchased by Glenmorangie PLC.
This Speyside single malt was aged for 30 Years prior to being bottled for the SMWS 12.37 release. It was distilled on the 23rd December 1988 from a refill ex bourbon Hogshead. It makes up part of the Vaults collection and is one of 212 bottles. Titled - Invitation to the promised land.

NAME: Ardbeg - 23 Year Old - Twenty Something (Committee Release)
DESCRIPTION: Released in late 2017, Ardbeg Twenty Something is 23 year old single malt matured in ex-Bourbon and ex-Oloroso Sherry casks. This is a limited edition committee bottling elected by Dr Bill Lumsden, Director of Distilling, Whisky Creation & Whisky Stocks at Ardbeg. He has created a non-chill filtered whisky that’s been bottled at 46.3% ABV.

NAME: Ardbeg - Very Young 1998 - 2004
DESCRIPTION:
Distilled in 1998, Ardbeg Very Young was released in 2004
It is part of a series called the ‘path to peaty maturity’.

NAME: Macallan - 18 Year Old - 2017 Release
DESCRIPTION: This Macallan 18 Year Old Single malt was bottled in 2017 in Speyside Scotland.  This classic was one of the last bottles in this shape.  It is now becoming rarer and a staple item in a collectors cellar!

NAME: Macallan - 18 Year Old - 2017 Release
DESCRIPTION: This Macallan 18 Year Old Single malt was bottled in 2017 in Speyside Scotland.  This classic was one of the last bottles in this shape.  It is now becoming rarer and a staple item in a collectors cellar!

NAME: Macallan - 18 Year Old - 2016 Release
DESCRIPTION: This Macallan 18 Year Old Single malt was bottled in 2016 in Speyside Scotland.  This classic was one of the last bottles in this shape.  It is now becoming rarer and a staple item in a collectors cellar!

NAME: Scapa - 8 Year Old Gordon and MacPhail 75cl
DESCRIPTION:
Arguably the most famous independent bottler of Scotch whisky there is. Gordon & MacPhail was founded in Elgin in 1895 by James Gordon and John Alexander MacPhail. It is now owned by the Urquhart Family who have bow bottled over 350 different expressions from around 69 different distilleries. Gordon & MacPhail is the Trading name of Speymalt Whiskies while also owning the Benromach distillery, which they purchased in 1993. Some of the brands include Connoisseurs Choice, Cask Strength, Rare Old and Speymalt.
This Orcadian single malt was distilled at Scapa and matured for 8 great years before being bottled by Gordon and Macphail.  Estimated to be from the 1980s.

NAME: Port Ellen - 23 Year Old (1983) #3042 - Old Malt Cask
DESCRIPTION: This single cask Port Ellen was bottled by Douglas Laing for their The Old Malt Cask Series.  This 1983 vintage was matured in single refill butt 3042 and bottled at the series strength of 50%.  This is one of just 549 bottles produced of this well-aged malt from the closed Islay distillery.

NAME: Springbank - 23 Year Old - Hunter Laing - Old & Rare 2019
DESCRIPTION:
Presented in this stunning wooden case with a silk-like varnished finish comes a Springbank 21 Year Old. It is one of only 136 bottles to be produced at 52.2%.
Part of the Old & Rare line from Hunter Laing this cask was laid down in 1995 and bottled in 2019. 
Bottled at cask strength.

NAME: Glendullan - 18 Year Old - Manager's Dram 1989
DESCRIPTION:
Now known as Diageo, this Glendullan 18YO is part of the Manager’s Dram series. 
The whiskies were bottled exclusively for employees of the company and were selected by the respective distillery managers. All of the bottles were distilled and bottled at natural cask strength.
Bottled in 1989.

NAME: Ardbeg - 23 Year Old - Twenty Something (Committee Release)
DESCRIPTION: Released in late 2017, Ardbeg Twenty Something is 23 year old single malt matured in ex-Bourbon and ex-Oloroso Sherry casks. This is a limited edition committee bottling elected by Dr Bill Lumsden, Director of Distilling, Whisky Creation & Whisky Stocks at Ardbeg. He has created a non-chill filtered whisky that’s been bottled at 46.3% ABV.

NAME: Ardbeg - 23 Year Old - Twenty Something (Committee Release)
DESCRIPTION: Released in late 2017, Ardbeg Twenty Something is 23 year old single malt matured in ex-Bourbon and ex-Oloroso Sherry casks. This is a limited edition committee bottling elected by Dr Bill Lumsden, Director of Distilling, Whisky Creation & Whisky Stocks at Ardbeg. He has created a non-chill filtered whisky that’s been bottled at 46.3% ABV.

NAME: Ardbeg - 23 Year Old - Twenty Something (Committee Release)
DESCRIPTION: Released in late 2017, Ardbeg Twenty Something is 23 year old single malt matured in ex-Bourbon and ex-Oloroso Sherry casks. This is a limited edition committee bottling elected by Dr Bill Lumsden, Director of Distilling, Whisky Creation & Whisky Stocks at Ardbeg. He has created a non-chill filtered whisky that’s been bottled at 46.3% ABV.

NAME: Waterford - SFO - Ballykilcavan,  Ratheadon, Ballymorgan & Sheestown 1.1
DESCRIPTION: This lot includes 4 x 70cl bottlings:

NAME: Lagavulin - Islay Jazz Festival 2013
DESCRIPTION:
This is the 2013 edition of the Lagavulin Islay Jazz Festival bottling. A collectable bottle released during their 200th Anniversary year - the whisky was drawn hand-selected casks Sherry Butts. 
In order to celebrate the 2013 Islay Jazz festival only 1,500 bottles of this delightful dram. 
This is bottle number 0678.

NAME: Glenturret - Limited Edition 1972
DESCRIPTION:
A limited release of 1972 vintage official Glenturret - bottled in 2002.
A lot of Glenturret malt goes into Famous Grouse. Glenturret claims to be Scotland's oldest distillery, though production was stopped between 1921 and 1959.
This is bottle number 211.

NAME: Ardbeg - 23 Year Old - Twenty Something (Committee Release)
DESCRIPTION: Released in late 2017, Ardbeg Twenty Something is 23 year old single malt matured in ex-Bourbon and ex-Oloroso Sherry casks. This is a limited edition committee bottling elected by Dr Bill Lumsden, Director of Distilling, Whisky Creation & Whisky Stocks at Ardbeg. He has created a non-chill filtered whisky that’s been bottled at 46.3% ABV.

NAME: Macallan - Rare Cask Black - Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION: The Macallan Rare Cask Black Limited Edition was released to celebrate the opening of the new Macallan Distillery.  It is part of the Macallan 1824 series and features stunning photography by Paolo Pellegrin and a bespoke flask from the Distillery Visitor Centre.  The release was a limited edition of 7000 sets, which were only available at airports.

NAME: Laphroaig - 17 Year Old 1989 - Fèis Ìle 2007
DESCRIPTION:
This is a 1989 vintage Laphroaig, bottled at 17 years of age. It was released for the Friends of Laphroaig for Feis Isle 2007 and to celebrate the opening of the 'Friends' lounge at the distillery.  
This is one of just 4000 bottles produced.

NAME: Ardbeg - 23 Year Old - Twenty Something (Committee Release)
DESCRIPTION: Released in late 2017, Ardbeg Twenty Something is 23 year old single malt matured in ex-Bourbon and ex-Oloroso Sherry casks. This is a limited edition committee bottling elected by Dr Bill Lumsden, Director of Distilling, Whisky Creation & Whisky Stocks at Ardbeg. He has created a non-chill filtered whisky that’s been bottled at 46.3% ABV.

NAME: Macallan - Edition No.5 ( 3x70cl)
DESCRIPTION: The fifth release in the Edition Series from The Macallan, The Macallan Edition No. 5 celebrates The Macallan’s extensive natural colour spectrum and the intricate whisky-making process, in partnership with masters at the Pantone Color Institute™ to create a unique shade of purple that features on the packaging.

NAME: Bimber - Southport Whisky Festival 2020
DESCRIPTION:
Only 275 bottles of this very limited edition single malt whisky fromBimber distillery has been produced in 2020. 
It matured in an American Oak ex-bourbon single cask #127.

NAME: Macallan - 18 Year Old - 2016 Release
DESCRIPTION: This Macallan 18 Year Old Single malt was bottled in 2016 in Speyside Scotland.  This classic was one of the last bottles in this shape.  It is now becoming rarer and a staple item in a collectors cellar!

NAME: Macallan - 12 Year Old - Giovinetti & Figli Milano Import
DESCRIPTION:
An early 1990s bottle of Macallan 12-year-old sherry wood, produced for the Italian market, imported by Giovinetti and Figli Milano.
This is a 75cl bottling.
Armando Giovinetti, famous among the whisky community, has often been known as the main link between Scotland and Itlay long-lasting history when it comes to single malts.  This bottle was imported by Giovinetti & Figli of Milan.

NAME: Macallan - 18 Year Old Sherry Oak (2018)
DESCRIPTION:
This annual release of The Macallan's popular 18 Year Old Sherry Oak is matured exclusively in sherry seasoned casks, built from both Spanish and American oak, providing a beautifully dark flavour with rich aromas.
The nose opens with dried fruits, ginger and hints of citrus with vanilla and cinnamon. The palate is rich in dried fruits, spices, orange, cloves and wood smoke, before a full and lingering finish with sweet toffee, ginger and a hint of smoke.

NAME: Highland Park 8 Year Old Bottled 1970s - Ferraretto
DESCRIPTION:
A rare bottle of Highland Park 8 Year Old that was bottled for the Italian importer Ferraretto.
This bottling is from the late 1970s.

NAME: Macallan - 12 Year Old - Sherry Oak
DESCRIPTION: This s and old-style bottling of the Macallan Sherry Oak 12-Year-Old which forms part of the Sherry Oak range which features a series of single malt whiskies matured exclusively in hand-picked sherry seasoned oak casks from Jerez for richness and complexity.

NAME: Bowmore - 17 Year Old One Small Step 2002 The Whisky Barrel
DESCRIPTION:
Islay’s oldest working distillery, Bowmore was established in 1779 and is now regarded as one of the most popular malts not only on Islay, but in the whole of Scotland. The distillery was acquired by Stanley P. Morrison in 1963, ushering in an era of iconic single malts, including the legendary Black Bowmore, credited by many as the genesis of whisky collecting, bottled in 1993. The distillery was bought under the control Suntory the year after they had been stakeholders since 1989), and it remains one of the most collectible brands in Scotch whisky today. Bowmore is one of the few remaining Scottish distilleries to use its own floor maltings, providing them with 40% of their requirements.
The unique microclimate of the No.1 Vaults warehouse at Bowmore distillery means casks share very little with the angels, and has allowed the distillery to bottle some spectacular age-statements over the years. These early Morrison Bowmore era vintages are considered classics, particualrly this parcel of 1964 vintage sherry casks. Indeed, it is hard to fathom where whisky collecting would be today without the Black Bowmore. 
This independent release is to commemorate the 51st anniversary of the Apollo Moon Landing in 1969. Distilled in 2002 and bottled in 2020 this 1st fill Oloroso Hogshead yielded only 270 bottles. Out of this world...and beyond!

NAME: Macallan - 1861 Replica
DESCRIPTION:
The 1861 Replica is part of a series of replicas from Macallan.  Released in 2001, this was the expression release in the series.
These pieces from Macallan are designed to reflect Macallans past style, in both it's presentation and by recreating the whisky's nose and flavour.

NAME: Macallan - 18 Year Old Sherry Oak (1996)
DESCRIPTION:
This annual release of The Macallan's popular 18 Year Old Sherry Oak is matured exclusively in sherry seasoned casks, built from both Spanish and American oak, providing a beautifully dark flavour with rich aromas.
The nose opens with dried fruits, ginger and hints of citrus with vanilla and cinnamon. The palate is rich in dried fruits, spices, orange, cloves and wood smoke, before a full and lingering finish with sweet toffee, ginger and a hint of smoke.

NAME: Ardbeg - 23 Year Old - Twenty Something (Committee Release)
DESCRIPTION: Released in late 2017, Ardbeg Twenty Something is 23 year old single malt matured in ex-Bourbon and ex-Oloroso Sherry casks. This is a limited edition committee bottling elected by Dr Bill Lumsden, Director of Distilling, Whisky Creation & Whisky Stocks at Ardbeg. He has created a non-chill filtered whisky that’s been bottled at 46.3% ABV.

NAME: Ardbeg - 23 Year Old - Twenty Something (Committee Release)
DESCRIPTION: Released in late 2017, Ardbeg Twenty Something is 23 year old single malt matured in ex-Bourbon and ex-Oloroso Sherry casks. This is a limited edition committee bottling elected by Dr Bill Lumsden, Director of Distilling, Whisky Creation & Whisky Stocks at Ardbeg. He has created a non-chill filtered whisky that’s been bottled at 46.3% ABV.

NAME: Game of Thrones - Limited Editions - 9 x 70cl (with Mortlach)
DESCRIPTION:
Game of Thrones series plus Johnnie Walker White Walker Game of Thrones edition. 
In celebration of the eighth and final season of the critically-acclaimed TV series, Game of Thrones, Diageo and HBO have released a limited-edition collection of single malt Scotch whiskies celebrating the show.
Each of the Game of Thrones Scotch whiskies has been paired with a particular house from the seven kingdoms in the television series, plus the final bottling in the Game of Thrones Single Malts Collection - Mortlach - 15 Year Old.
Dalwhinnie Winter’s Frost - 43%: House StarkSingleton of Glendullan Select - 40%: House TullyCardhu Gold Reserve 40%: House TargaryenLagavulin 9 Year Old - 46%: House LannisterOban Bay Reserve - 43%: The Night’s WatchTalisker Select Reserve - 45.8%: House GreyjoyRoyal Lochnagar 12 Year Old - 40%: House BaratheonClynelish Reserve – 51.2%: House TyrelMortlach - 15 Year Old - Game of Thrones - 46% This lot contains 9 x 70cl bottles - one of each listed above.

NAME: Macallan - Enigma (3x70cl)
DESCRIPTION: Enigma is at the top end of Macallan's Quest Collection (released for the Travel Retail market).  The expression has been drawn exclusively from European oak Sherry seasons casks from one cooperage in Jerez de la Frontera, Spain.  The Macallan Enigma is a testament that every end has a new beginning, always venturing on the brink of a new discovery.

NAME: Ardbeg - 22 Year Old - Twenty Something - Committee Release
DESCRIPTION:
The 2018 edition of the Twenty Something releases, the third bottled exclusively for the Ardbeg Committee, the distillery's fan club.
This 22 year old was distilled in 1996, when the distillery was under the threat of demolition.  It was one of the last distillations in Ardbeg’s old equipment – these stills now sit monumentally outside the distillery gates.  The single malt was matured in ex-bourbon barrels from of some of the most limited stock in any Scottish distillery warehouse.

NAME: Glendronach - 24 Year Old - 1992 Single cask #43
DESCRIPTION:
Aged in a single Oloroso sherry butt for 24 years, this rare 1992 vintage bottling of Glendronach is a UK exclusive boasting a mixture of spicy notes and herbal character. Bottled in 2016, this is one of 644 individually numbered bottles.
This is bottle number 246.

NAME: Glenfiddich - Winter Storm #3 (3 x 70cl)
DESCRIPTION: This is the third release in Glenfiddich's Experimental Series by Malt Master Brian Kinsman and the first to be a limited batch release.  This 21 year old Glenfiddich has been finished in an ice wine cask from Peller Estate in Niagra, Canada.

NAME: Clynelish - 20 Year Old - 200th Anniversary (Distillery Exclusive)
DESCRIPTION: Bottled in the highlands, this 20-year-old single malt from Clynelish was bottled to commemorate the distilleries 200th anniversary. In a beautifully presented box this cask strength malt was made only available from the distillery in 2019. It was matured in a combination of Bodega Sherry European Oak and Refill American oak casks to create a stunning expression.

NAME: Glendronach - 26 Year Old - 1994 Hand Filled - Cask #7459
DESCRIPTION:
A Distillery Exclusive from Glendronach has been hand filled straight from the cask, at the cask strength of 53.4% ABV.
It was distilled on 15th of July 1994, aged in an Oloroso puncheon number 7459 and bottled on 15th July 2020.
This is bottle number 402.

NAME: Macallan - 10 Year Old (1990s)
DESCRIPTION: This is an old-style presentation of Macallan 10 Year old was bottled in the 1990s. This classic Speyside malt whisky matured in sherry oak casks from Jerez. Very collectable.

NAME: Royal Brackla - 20 Year Old 1978 Rare Malts
DESCRIPTION:
The Rare Malts Selection is now-discontinued - but it was a series of cask-strength releases designed by Diageo to showcase some of the hidden treasures in their portfolio.
A highland expression from the series at a well aged 20 years. This Royal Brackla has been bottled at its cask strength of 59.8%,

NAME: Glenmorangie - 25 Year Old Quarter Century
DESCRIPTION: Possibly one of Glenmorangie's most striking presentations of a 25 year old whisky. A golden box to match the liquid within that has been matured in both sherry and Burgundy casks.

NAME: Aultmore - 12 Year Old - Flora & Fauna (with Box)
DESCRIPTION: This is the first release of Aultmore as part of the Flora & Fauna range. The 12 year old single malt was released in 1991 - it is one of the earlier Flora & Fauna bottlings, and comes with a lovely light wood presentation box.

NAME: Hakushu - 18 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: Hakushu 18 Year Old is part of the Suntory group. Not many people know, but at the time of writing this descrpition, Bowmore is part of this conglomerate.

NAME: Laphroaig - 25 Year Old - 2009
DESCRIPTION:
This is the 2009 annual release of Laphroaig 25 Year Old.  This edition was matured in Oloroso sherry and American oak casks and bottled at 51%.
The bottling is non-chilled filtered, with notes of classic Islay peat complemented by oak, sherried sweetness and spice.

NAME: Ki Noh Bi - Karuizawa Cask-Aged Gin - 3rd Edition
DESCRIPTION:
The world of Japanese gin meets the world of Japanese whisky.
 This release is from Kyoto Distillery's Ki No Bi Gin range - 3rd edition.  The gin has been aged in sherry casks that were previously used to mature whisky from the legendary Karuizawa distillery

NAME: Bowmore - 12 Year Old - 1980s
DESCRIPTION: This is an iconic old dumpy style 75cl bottle of Bowmore 12-year-old Bowmore estimated to be from the 1980s.  It was bottled when the distillery was Morrison's Bowmore before it was bought over by Suntory in 1989.

NAME: Macallan - 18 Year Old - 2016 Release
DESCRIPTION: This Macallan 18 Year Old Single malt was bottled in 2016 in Speyside Scotland.  This classic was one of the last bottles in this shape.  It is now becoming rarer and a staple item in a collectors cellar!

NAME: Macallan - 18 Year Old Sherry Oak (1996)
DESCRIPTION:
This annual release of The Macallan's popular 18 Year Old Sherry Oak is matured exclusively in sherry seasoned casks, built from both Spanish and American oak, providing a beautifully dark flavour with rich aromas.
The nose opens with dried fruits, ginger and hints of citrus with vanilla and cinnamon. The palate is rich in dried fruits, spices, orange, cloves and wood smoke, before a full and lingering finish with sweet toffee, ginger and a hint of smoke.

NAME: Macallan - 18 Year Old Sherry Oak (1996)
DESCRIPTION:

The nose opens with dried fruits, ginger and hints of citrus with vanilla and cinnamon. The palate is rich in dried fruits, spices, orange, cloves and wood smoke, before a full and lingering finish with sweet toffee, ginger and a hint of smoke.

NAME: Macallan - 18 Year Old Sherry Oak (1996)
DESCRIPTION:
This annual release of The Macallan's popular 18 Year Old Sherry Oak is matured exclusively in sherry seasoned casks, built from both Spanish and American oak, providing a beautifully dark flavour with rich aromas.
The nose opens with dried fruits, ginger and hints of citrus with vanilla and cinnamon. The palate is rich in dried fruits, spices, orange, cloves and wood smoke, before a full and lingering finish with sweet toffee, ginger and a hint of smoke.

NAME: Glen Flagler - 100% Malt Pot Still Scotch Whisky
DESCRIPTION: From the now closed distillery, This lowland bottling comes from Glan Flagler distillery. A rare malt and in its day would have been produced in what some may consider a golden age.

NAME: Macallan-Glenlivet - 25 Year Old - 1989 Cadenhead's
DESCRIPTION: Distilled at Macallan-Glenlivet, this 1989 vintage Speyside single malt was bottled by W.M Cadenhead Limited at 25 years old. Matured in a single bourbon barrel, it was bottled in October 2014 for the Authentic Collection series. This is one of just 156 bottles.

NAME: Laphroaig - Scottish Folklore Series - 3nd Release - Cask 88
DESCRIPTION:
This is the 3nd release of the Scottish Folklore Series with a bottling of a 19 year old Laphroaig Malt by the Cask 88 company. It was distilled on 14th January 2001 in Chateau Leoville-Las Cases Bordeaux cask #1700369.
The bottle number is 119.

NAME: Abhainn Dearg - 10 Year Old
DESCRIPTION:
From the most westerly distillery in Scotland this is the first 10 year old from the Outer Hebrides. Only 100 bottles were produced. Mautred in ex-bourbon casks that have traces of Kentucky's Buffalo Trace distillery.
This is bottle number 67.

NAME: Laphroaig - 27 Year Old Limited Edition 1989
DESCRIPTION:
Laphroaig 27 Year Old limited edition from Islay Scotland. 
Distilled: 1989 (October) - 2017(March).
"The most richly flavoured of all Scotch Whiskies" has been aged in ex-bourbon barrels and refill Quarter Casks.

NAME: Macallan - Rare Cask Black - Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION: The Macallan Rare Cask Black Limited Edition was released to celebrate the opening of the new Macallan Distillery.  It is part of the Macallan 1824 series and features stunning photography by Paolo Pellegrin and a bespoke flask from the Distillery Visitor Centre.  The release was a limited edition of 7000 sets, which were only available at airports.

NAME: Game of Thrones - Limited Editions - 9 x 70cl (with Mortlach)
DESCRIPTION:
Game of Thrones series plus Johnnie Walker White Walker Game of Thrones edition. 
In celebration of the eighth and final season of the critically-acclaimed TV series, Game of Thrones, Diageo and HBO have released a limited-edition collection of single malt Scotch whiskies celebrating the show.
Each of the Game of Thrones Scotch whiskies has been paired with a particular house from the seven kingdoms in the television series, plus the final bottling in the Game of Thrones Single Malts Collection - Mortlach - 15 Year Old.

NAME: Hibiki - 17 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: A world-famous Japanese blend, made with specially aged malt and grain whiskies from Suntory's distilleries. This popular blend was matured in mizunara casks for over seventeen years and has been awarded an "Editor's Choice" from Whisky Magazine.

NAME: Macallan - 18 Year Old Sherry Oak (2018)
DESCRIPTION:
This annual release of The Macallan's popular 18 Year Old Sherry Oak is matured exclusively in sherry seasoned casks, built from both Spanish and American oak, providing a beautifully dark flavour with rich aromas.
The nose opens with dried fruits, ginger and hints of citrus with vanilla and cinnamon. The palate is rich in dried fruits, spices, orange, cloves and wood smoke, before a full and lingering finish with sweet toffee, ginger and a hint of smoke.

NAME: Macallan - 1841 Replica
DESCRIPTION:
The 1841 Replica is the third is a series of replicas from Macallan which was released in 2003 following the 1861 and 1874 reproductions.
These antique-esque pieces from Macallan are to reflect on their past both in looks and in looks and in terms of recreating the whisky's nose and flavour.

NAME: Macallan - 1861 Replica
DESCRIPTION:
The 1861 Replica is part of a series of replicas from Macallan.  Released in 2001, this was the expression release in the series.
These pieces from Macallan are designed to reflect Macallans past style, in both it's presentation and by recreating the whisky's nose and flavour.

NAME: Glen Mhor - 22 Year Old 61% 1979 Rare Malt
DESCRIPTION:
This wonderful series was created by United Distillers, using bottlings from mostly closed distilleries in 1995. The single malts were distilled between the late 60’s and early 80’s maturing for at least 18 years each and some even reaching 30 years. Due to the great success of this, an annual release was formed, aptly named “Special Releases” in 2001. Distilleries on that list include Benrinnes, Brora, Linkwood & Teaninich.
Distilled in 1979 this Glen Mhor is 22 years old. Bottled a 61%.

NAME: Ardbeg - Rollercoaster - Committee Release
DESCRIPTION: This Ardbeg Rollercoaster was released exclusively to the Ardbeg Committee in June 2010 to mark the 10th anniversary of The Ardbeg Committee.  The Rollercoaster consists of ten vintages from 1997 to 2006.

NAME: Macallan - 18 Year Old Sherry Oak (2018)
DESCRIPTION:
This annual release of The Macallan's popular 18 Year Old Sherry Oak is matured exclusively in sherry seasoned casks, built from both Spanish and American oak, providing a beautifully dark flavour with rich aromas.
The nose opens with dried fruits, ginger and hints of citrus with vanilla and cinnamon. The palate is rich in dried fruits, spices, orange, cloves and wood smoke, before a full and lingering finish with sweet toffee, ginger and a hint of smoke.

NAME: Springbank - 15 Year Old Frest Port Hogshead 2003 Society Bottling
DESCRIPTION:
Found in one of the most remote parts of Scotland, the Springbank distillery is still family-owned. Situated on the western parts of Scotland on the Kintyre Peninsula, it is owned by J & A Mitchell & Company. They also own Glengyle Distillery, William Cadenheads (the oldest independent bottler) and several other blended scotch labels. They are tough cookies down in this neck of the world where by they are one of the last surviving producers of single malt whiskies in Campbeltown. They have been licensed in 1828 and at one time the area had over thirty active distilleries. The distillery produces both peated and unpeated expressions under distinct brands. Springbank, Hazlewood, Longrow & Kilkerran.
This is one of only 1020 bottles produced from a Fresh Port Hogshead. It was distilled in 2003 and bottled in Sept 2018. This 15 year old was selected for society members by Findlay Ross.

NAME: Clynelish - 20 Year Old - 200th Anniversary (Distillery Exclusive)
DESCRIPTION: Bottled in the highlands, this 20-year-old single malt from Clynelish was bottled to commemorate the distilleries 200th anniversary. In a beautifully presented box this cask strength malt was made only available from the distillery in 2019. It was matured in a combination of Bodega Sherry European Oak and Refill American oak casks to create a stunning expression.

NAME: Macallan - 10 Year Old - Tin (1990s)
DESCRIPTION: A 1990's bottling of 10 year old Macallan, matured in sherry wood with a presentation tin depicting Easter Elchies House.

NAME: Bunnahabhain - 1988 30 Year Old - Marsala Finish
DESCRIPTION:
This 1988 vintage single malt from Bunnahabhain is extremely limited and is one of just 1118 bottles produced.  Distilled in December 1988, and matured in warehouse 8, this single malt spent its final two years of maturation in marsala hogsheads.
Bottled in Jan 2019, at 47.4%.
 
 
Bottle 812.

NAME: Glenfarclas - 30 Year Old - Warehouse
DESCRIPTION: This 30 year old Glenfarclas has the generous sherried notes the distillery is famous for.  It comes in an eye-catching box reminiscent of the iconic doors of Glenfarclas' warehouse.

NAME: Bunnahabhain - 25 Year Old - XXV
DESCRIPTION: This 25 year old from Bunnahabhain distillery is a sherried, only lightly peated dram that is part of a limited release of just 400 bottles. It was also Bunnahabhains second release of unchilled-filtered, natural colour, single malts.

NAME: Laphroaig - 10 Year Old - Pre Royal Warrant
DESCRIPTION: These are a special bottling of Laphroaig 10-year-old that were around before Laphroaig was granted the Royal Warrant.  Every bottle since has featured the Coat of Arms of HRH.  This is a 75cl bottling.

NAME: Macallan - Rare Cask Black - Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION: The Macallan Rare Cask Black Limited Edition was released to celebrate the opening of the new Macallan Distillery.  It is part of the Macallan 1824 series and features stunning photography by Paolo Pellegrin and a bespoke flask from the Distillery Visitor Centre.  The release was a limited edition of 7000 sets, which were only available at airports.

NAME: Glenfarclas - 1998 Family Cask Summer 2018 #3587
DESCRIPTION:
Owned by the Grant family, this Speyside distillery in Ballindalloch has 6 stills and has a production capacity of around 3.5 million litres of spirit per year. 
Around 68,000 casks are being kept maturing for the future.
This bottling is part of their family cask selection, bottled in 02/07/28 this is one of only 470 bottles produced.

NAME: Game of Thrones - Limited Editions - 9 x 70cl (with Mortlach)
DESCRIPTION:
Game of Thrones series plus Johnnie Walker White Walker Game of Thrones edition. 
In celebration of the eighth and final season of the critically-acclaimed TV series, Game of Thrones, Diageo and HBO have released a limited-edition collection of single malt Scotch whiskies celebrating the show.
Each of the Game of Thrones Scotch whiskies has been paired with a particular house from the seven kingdoms in the television series, plus the final bottling in the Game of Thrones Single Malts Collection - Mortlach - 15 Year Old.
