NAME: Clynelish - 20 Year Old - 200th Anniversary (Distillery Exclusive)
DESCRIPTION: Bottled in the highlands, this 20-year-old single malt from Clynelish was bottled to commemorate the distilleries 200th anniversary. In a beautifully presented box this cask strength malt was made only available from the distillery in 2019. It was matured in a combination of Bodega Sherry European Oak and Refill American oak casks to create a stunning expression.

NAME: Ardbeg - Rollercoaster - Committee Release
DESCRIPTION: This Ardbeg Rollercoaster was released exclusively to the Ardbeg Committee in June 2010 to mark the 10th anniversary of The Ardbeg Committee.  The Rollercoaster consists of ten vintages from 1997 to 2006.

NAME: Ardbeg - 2002 SMWS 33.139
DESCRIPTION:
Founded in Edinburgh in 1983 by Phillip 'Pip' Hills comes The Scotch Malt Whisky Society. His passion for whisky started when he was travelling around the country in the 70s. After which, it took his little time to purchase his first cask with a group of friends. Many years later the syndicate was purchased by Glenmorangie PLC.
This Ardbeg 33.139 "You Would Not Believe It" is a 12 year old, One of only 603 bottles being distilled in celebration of Islay Festival 2020. This bottle is from a 2nd Fill Oloroso Butt.

NAME: Ardbeg - 21 Year Old - Committee Release 2016
DESCRIPTION: Ardbeg Twenty One came from a Bourbon cask and matured for 21 years. In 2016 the fan club got the opportunity to purchase this committee release. They most certainly won't be disappointed if they grabbed that opportunity with both hands!

NAME: Hibiki - 17 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: A world-famous Japanese blend, made with specially aged malt and grain whiskies from Suntory's distilleries. This popular blend was matured in mizunara casks for over seventeen years and has been awarded an "Editor's Choice" from Whisky Magazine.

NAME: Macallan - Rare Cask Black - 2018
DESCRIPTION:
The Macallan Rare Cask Black is a one-off, relatively small release of fewer than 100 casks.  These were predominantly first fill European and American oak sherry casks. 
This whisky tells the story of rarity.  These mysterious casks remained untouched in the dark warehouses of The Macallan under the watchful eye of their Master Whisky Maker, until he felt they were ready to be released.  This out of character, smokier Macallan was released exclusively to the global travel retail market.

NAME: Aultmore - 1983 Flora and Fauna Cask Strength​
DESCRIPTION: This is a very rare release as part of the Flora & Fauna of which there was only 9 different bottles in the series. It was bottled at cask strength in 1997 and distilled back in 1983.

NAME: Bowmore - 21 Year Old 1998 - Hand Fill #58
DESCRIPTION:
This single malt bottle of Bowmore has been distilled in sherry casks for 21 years. 
It is bottle number 568.

NAME: Yamazaki - 12 Year Old (x3)
DESCRIPTION:
This lot includes 3 x Yamazaki 12-Year-Old 70cl bottlings.
This 12 year old Yamazaki is said to be multi-layered in taste and is highly praised by whisky connoisseurs.  It first came onto the scene in 1984 and was the first seriously marketed Japanese single malt whisky.  Yamazaki is arguably the number 1 single malt whisky in Japan and this would be a great contender for Suntory’s flagship single malt.

NAME: Hakushu - 18 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: Hakushu 18 Year Old is part of the Suntory group. Not many people know, but at the time of writing this descrpition, Bowmore is part of this conglomerate.

NAME: Highland Park - 16 Year Old - Thor
DESCRIPTION:
This stunning bottle is the first part of Highland Park's Valhalla Collection and was released in 2012
Thor is a 16-Year-Old single malt named after the Norse God of Thunder and alleged architect of the Cliffs of Yesnaby on the west coast of Orkney Mainland.  This bottling comes with a striking wooden stand that resembles a Viking boat.
There are 23,000 bottles of Thor.

NAME: Kavalan - SMWS 1st Fill Barrique Port 139.5 Midnight Espresso
DESCRIPTION:
Founded in Edinburgh in 1983 by Phillip 'Pip' Hills comes The Scotch Malt Whisky Society. His passion for whisky started when he was travelling around the country in the 70s. After which, it took his little time to purchase his first cask with a group of friends. Many years later the syndicate was purchased by Glenmorangie PLC.
SMWS cask No 139.50, is one of the very first releases from Kavalan and bottled by SMWS. The distillery, based in Taiwan filled a 1st fill Barrique and bottled only 181 bottles from this cask.

NAME: Macallan Mirror
DESCRIPTION:
A beautiful piece of Macallan memorabilia and a must have for any Macallan collector.  
40cm wide and 53cm tall. Please note this lot does not come with TGWA glass, it is for size purposes only.

NAME: Auchentoshan - 31 Year Old 1966
DESCRIPTION:
An Auchentoshan 31 Year Old that was distilled in 1966 and bottled from a single cask. 
This distillery bottling is becoming rarer all the time and to find a malt of this age from this distillery is quite special!
Cask #511 was a Hogshead.

NAME: Highland Park - 12 Year Old (Old Style) x 6
DESCRIPTION:
Highland Park 12 year old - one of the best malts in the world year on year. This bottling has been in its core range for over 100 years. This design of bottle was used by Highland Park from 1999-early 2000s.
This classic 1990s bottling was said to be whisky author Michael Jackson’s favourite tipple.

NAME: Hibiki - 17 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: A world-famous Japanese blend, made with specially aged malt and grain whiskies from Suntory's distilleries. This popular blend was matured in mizunara casks for over seventeen years and has been awarded an "Editor's Choice" from Whisky Magazine.

NAME: Johnnie Walker - Blue Label - Ghost and Rare (Brora)
DESCRIPTION: From all across Scotland comes this three-part series named Ghost and rare from Johnnie Walker. All of the distilleries that are the main feature behind the bottling are closed.  Brora is the first Release in the series. A smooth blend of eight treasured Scotch Whiskies including three "ghost" whiskies from the silent distilleries of Cambus, Pittyvaich and the Highland Single Malt, Brora, which lies at the heart of this special release.

NAME: Rosebank - 12 Year Old - Flora & Fauna
DESCRIPTION: This is an increasingly hard to find bottling, from the closed and now redeveloped Rosebank distillery.   It is a classic lowland malt and is part of the 26-bottle 'Flora & Fauna' series, made famous by whisky writer Michael Jackson.  Rosebank produced some of the most beautiful and delicate whiskies and this is true of this summery dram.

NAME: Bowmore - 22 Year Old Signatory 1982
DESCRIPTION:
Distilled at the legendary Bowmore distillery on Islay, which is the oldest official distillery on the island. This has been matured for 22 years before being bottled by Signatory. 
This dram has been bottled at cask strength 51%
Cask No 1314.

NAME: GlenDronach - 25 Year Old - 1993 Sherry Butt #658
DESCRIPTION:
Distilled in March 1993 and bottled in 2018 from single sherry butt #658. Matured for 25 years and then bottled at 59.3%. Specially selected and bottled exclusively for The Whisky Barrel. This is one of 557 bottles.  
 
This is bottle number 497.

NAME: Glengoyne - 19 Year Old - 1998 Single Cask
DESCRIPTION:
This bottle of Glengoyne was distilled on the 2nd July 1998 into a European Oak Sherry Butt which was cask #1921 before being bottled 19 years later in January 2018 at 56.6% ABV. There are only 594 bottles. 
 
Bottle 84.

NAME: Highland Park - 11 Year Old - The Battle of Jutland
DESCRIPTION: This expression was distilled in 2004, and matured in a refill puncheon cask #3378 for 11 years.  582 bottles were produced to commemorate the largest naval battle of WW1 fought between British and German naval forces with much of the British fleet dispatched from Orkney’s Scapa Flow bay.

NAME: Aultmore - 1983 Flora and Fauna Cask Strength​
DESCRIPTION: This is a very rare release as part of the Flora & Fauna of which there was only 9 different bottles in the series. It was bottled at cask strength in 1997 and distilled back in 1983.

NAME: Caroni - 23 Year Old Full Proof Blended Tasting Gang 1996 Velier
DESCRIPTION:
Caroni was established in 1918 and can be found in the centre of Trinidad's Caroni plains. It is a single estate distillery and possesses its own sugar plant. In the very early days they used a cast iron pot still, which in later years was replaced with a single column style still. Caroni became famous for its very distinctive heavy style of rum. A year after the distillery closed in 2004 Italian raconteur Luca Gargano headed to Trinidad and came across the derelict distillery. On a photoshoot he stumbled across a warehouse full of Caroni barrels and in the next few years the barrels were purchased.
The distillery now has legendary status among collectors and fans. This is the 38th release in the series and also the penultimate.

NAME: Clynelish - 27 Year Old (1989) - Carn Mor
DESCRIPTION:
This Clynelish was bottled by Càrn Mòr for their 'Celebration of The Cask' limited bottling range.  The single malt was aged in a hogshead cask from September 1989 to May 2016. 277 bottles of this whisky were produced, and it has been presented at 54.5% ABV.
This is bottle 252.

NAME: Rosebank - 19 Year Old 1990 Old Malt Cask
DESCRIPTION:
From the Lowland distillery, that is closed at present but is due to reopen, this Rosebank has been matured for 19 years. It was distilled in Feb 1990 and bottled in March 2009.
It comes from a refill butt Ref: 5082.

NAME: Pittyvaich - 29 Year Old - 2019 Special Release
DESCRIPTION: Pittyvaich, from the most shortlived and now, lost distillery, comes this 29-Year-Old single malt which was released by Diageo as part of the 2019 Special Releases. Double matured in PX and Oloroso seasoned casks and bottled at the natural cask strength of 51.4%. Limited to only 5568 bottles.

NAME: Pittyvaich - 29 Year Old - 2019 Special Release
DESCRIPTION: Pittyvaich, from the most shortlived and now, lost distillery, comes this 29-Year-Old single malt which was released by Diageo as part of the 2019 Special Releases. Double matured in PX and Oloroso seasoned casks and bottled at the natural cask strength of 51.4%. Limited to only 5568 bottles.

NAME: Longmorn - 23 Year Old SMWS 7.44
DESCRIPTION:
Founded in Edinburgh in 1983 by Phillip 'Pip' Hills comes The Scotch Malt Whisky Society. His passion for whisky started when he was travelling around the country in the 70s. After which, it took his little time to purchase his first cask with a group of friends. Many years later the syndicate was purchased by Glenmorangie PLC.
This 23 year old was distilled in October 1984 and was bottled in June 2008 - 'Scents of Cedar & Pine).

NAME: Macallan - Concept No.2 - 2019 (3x70cl)
DESCRIPTION:
This is the second bottle in the series and was unveiled at the TFWA World Exhibition & Conference in Cannes, France. The series is rumoured to be of three parts after maturing the spirit in sherry and being moved into ex-bourbon casks.
Concept Number 2 is a creation by our good friend and Macallan whisky maker Steven Bremner. It revolves around his two great passions, Whisky and Music.
“Building music is in some ways the same as building whisky.
“In music, you have to lay down the base track, just like you create the base flavour in whisky, and then you build layers around them.”
Concept No. 2 has been matured in Sherry-seasoned American oak casks, Miguel Martin Sherry casks and ex-Bourbon barrels.

NAME: Thomas H Handy - Sazerac Rye 2019 Release 62.85%
DESCRIPTION:
This bottling is part of an annual release by Buffalo Trace and the 2019 release is bottled at 62.85% ABV. 
This collection is dubbed the antique collection and celebrates famous figures. The companies founder, Thomas H. Handy, is on the front of this bottle with the picture of the Sazerac Coffee House where everything started.

NAME: Glen Grant - 36 Year Old Duncan Taylor 1974 #16560
DESCRIPTION:
An independant bottler, based in Huntly, that has produced some amazing whiskies over the years and goes by the name of Duncan Taylor. Their most common lines are Black Bull, Indian Summer, Smokin', The Octave, The Rarest, Tantalus and Rare Auld. Duncan Taylor founded in 1938 as a cask broker and trading company in Glasgow. The company built strong ties over the years with distillers and distilleries over Scotland. They eventually run their own casks to different distilleries to be filled and this resulted in a superb collection of casks from different distilleries. As it transpires, many of these are now closed. Lucky for them, their casks are maturing nicely in their warehouses! Euan Shand took over the company in 2001, who has a wide range of industry experience and has has time at Glendronach distillery, William Teacher’s & Sons, and founding/running The Bennachie Whisky Company.
This Glen Grant has been matured for over 36 years in cask #16560 and was bottled in 2001. It is one of only 204 bottles.

NAME: Nikka - Armor of King
DESCRIPTION:
At the time and still today this is a rather iconic version of the Nikka release what was only available in the Japanese duty-free.
The bottle is encased by an armoured Knight.

NAME: The Laphroaig Collection -  2 x 10 Year Old, 15 Year Old (3 x 33.33cl)
DESCRIPTION:
A great chance to sample some of the finest whiskies that the Islay giant has to offer.
Within this triple pack, we have the great 10 year old expression recognised all over the world. 
From here you could move onto the discontinued 15 year old and then to finish the 10 year old straight from the wood at the cask strength of 55.7%

NAME: Glenmorangie - 1987 LVMH Take Over Bottling
DESCRIPTION:
This "Special Bottling" was distilled in 1987 and bottled in 2004. It was commissioned to celebrate and remember the succesful sale of Glenmorangie to Louis Vuitton Moet Hennessy.
Only 346 were ever produced.

NAME: Glendronach - 21 Year Old - 1994 Single PX #1189
DESCRIPTION:
Distilled in 1994 in October 2016 and matured a single Pedro Ximenez Sherry Puncheon #1189 for 21 years.  This is one of 731 individually bottles that were exclusively available from the distillery. 
This is bottle number 103.

NAME: Macallan - Rare Cask Black - 2018
DESCRIPTION:
The Macallan Rare Cask Black is a one-off, relatively small release of fewer than 100 casks.  These were predominantly first fill European and American oak sherry casks. 
This whisky tells the story of rarity.  These mysterious casks remained untouched in the dark warehouses of The Macallan under the watchful eye of their Master Whisky Maker, until he felt they were ready to be released.  This out of character, smokier Macallan was released exclusively to the global travel retail market.

NAME: Fettercairn - 27 Year Old - 1988 Signatory
DESCRIPTION:
This 27-year-old Fettercairn was bottled by independent bottler Signatory Vinatge Scotch Whisky Co. This single cask bottling was distilled in 07/12/1988, matured in hogshead #1996 and was bottled in June 2018.  This is one of just 261 numbered bottles.
 
 
This is bottle number 199.

NAME: Bowmore - 24 Year Old - 2019 Hand Fill - Sherry Cask #1558
DESCRIPTION:
This is a stunning single cask handfill from Bowmore Distillery. This is one of the oldest distillery exclusive single casks to be released to date.
It was distilled in July 1995 and matured in sherry cask #1558 for 24 years until September 2019 when it was bottled at 48.8% abv. 
This bottle is number nine.

NAME: Macallan - 18 Year Old Sherry Oak (2020)
DESCRIPTION:
This annual release of The Macallan's popular 18 Year Old Sherry Oak is matured exclusively in sherry seasoned casks, built from both Spanish and American oak, providing a beautifully dark flavour with rich aromas.
The nose opens with dried fruits, ginger and hints of citrus with vanilla and cinnamon. The palate is rich in dried fruits, spices, orange, cloves and wood smoke, before a full and lingering finish with sweet toffee, ginger and a hint of smoke.

NAME: Bowmore - 24 Year Old - 2019 Hand Fill - Sherry Cask #1558
DESCRIPTION:
This is a stunning single cask handfill from Bowmore Distillery. This is one of the oldest distillery exclusive single casks to be released to date.
It was distilled in July 1995 and matured in sherry cask #1558 for 24 years until September 2019 when it was bottled at 48.8% abv. 
Bottle 458.

This is bottle number 566.

DESCRIPTION:

Distilled on 19th November 1993 and bottled on 11th August 2015 after maturing for 21 years at cask strength 49.4% ABV. 
Bottled at cask strength and it is one of only 250 bottles. 
This is bottle number 35.

This Fèis Ìle 2020 edition has been expertly tuned to give its own unique and memorable performance. Bottled at the natural cask strength of 54%. This is one of just 6000 bottles released.

NAME: Lagavulin - 1989 Distillers Edition 2005
DESCRIPTION:
Lagavulin 1989 Distillers Edition was double matured and was bottled in 2005 at 43% ABV.  Lagavulin is the most sought after bottling of the Distiller’s Edition range.
Batch No. lgv.4/493

NAME: Macallan - Rare Cask Black - 2018
DESCRIPTION:
The Macallan Rare Cask Black is a one-off, relatively small release of fewer than 100 casks.  These were predominantly first fill European and American oak sherry casks.

NAME: Highland Park - 12 Year Old 2000 Cask Strength
DESCRIPTION:
A very unique edition of the Highland Park, for the first time has been bottled at cask strength.
With serious notes of Peat, smokiness and heather honey this bottle represents a "rare treat'.
The most Northernmost Distillery in Scotland has once again produced an exceptional malt.

NAME: Pappy Van Winkle - The Perfect Measure Tasting Set - TWE (5x3cl)
DESCRIPTION: Pappy Van Winkle - The Perfect Measure Tasting Set by The Whisky Exchange (5x3cl):

NAME: Laphroaig - 25 Year Old 2013 Cask Strength
DESCRIPTION:
This is the 2013 annual release of Laphroaig 25 Year Old.  This edition was matured in Oloroso sherry and American oak casks and bottled at 45.1%.
The bottling is non-chilled filtered, with notes of classic Islay peat complemented by oak, sherried sweetness and spice.

NAME: Hazelburn - 8 Year Old - First Edition Set
DESCRIPTION:
This lot has 3 x 70cl bottles of Hazelburn which is a triple distilled, completley unpeated single malt produced at Campeltown's Springbank Distillery. To celebrate the First Release Hazelburn, Springbank Distillers Ltd commissioned artist Ian Gray to paint 3 pictures of the distillery. These 3 paintings were then turned into both labels and a series of limited edition prints. 
There are 1700 bottles with each label released.

DESCRIPTION:
This 20-year-old Lagavulin was matured in a carefully selected mix of refill and PX/Oloroso seasoned casks personally selected by distillery manager Colin Gordon. This Fèis Ìle 2020 edition has been expertly tuned to give its own unique and memorable performance. Bottled at the natural cask strength of 54%. This is one of just 6000 bottles released.
This is bottle number 680.

NAME: Lagavulin - 20 Year Old - Fèis Ìle 2020
DESCRIPTION: This 20-year-old Lagavulin was matured in a carefully selected mix of refill and PX/Oloroso seasoned casks personally selected by distillery manager Colin Gordon. NAME: Filey Bay - First Release - Yorkshire Single Malt
DESCRIPTION: The first release of Yorkshire's first single malt - ever. Made the Yorkshire way, from field to bottle, with heart and grit.

NAME: Ardbeg - 17 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: Ardbeg 17 year old is an increasingly rare bottling, it has been discontinued for a good few years. The first bottling of this sparked the revival of Ardbeg's fortunes after the takeover by Glenmorangie.

NAME: Bowmore - 20 Year Old - 2019 Hand Fill - PX Cask #26
DESCRIPTION:
This Bowmore hand fill comes from the legendary No.1 Vaults on Islay after being held in a 1st fill PX Sherry Cask for 20 years!
Arguably one of the nicest bottles to come from the distillery this year so far and the fact it can only be bought from the Island makes it even rarer.
Distillation Date - 20/1/1999
Date Bottled - 16/7/2019

NAME: Glengoyne - 19 Year Old - 1998 Single Cask
DESCRIPTION:
This bottle of Glengoyne was distilled on the 2nd July 1998 into a European Oak Sherry Butt which was cask #1921 before being bottled 19 years later in January 2018 at 56.6% ABV. There are only 594 bottles. 
 
This is bottle number 562.

NAME: Ardbeg - 17 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: Ardbeg 17 year old is an increasingly rare bottling, it has been discontinued for a good few years. The first bottling of this sparked the revival of Ardbeg's fortunes after the takeover by Glenmorangie.

NAME: Rosebank - 12 Year Old - Flora & Fauna
DESCRIPTION: This is an increasingly hard to find bottling, from the closed and now redeveloped Rosebank distillery.   It is a classic lowland malt and is part of the 26-bottle 'Flora & Fauna' series, made famous by whisky writer Michael Jackson.  Rosebank produced some of the most beautiful and delicate whiskies and this is true of this summery dram.

NAME: Prometheus - 26 Year Old - Speyside - Cache 1
DESCRIPTION:
A 26 year old single cask Speyside single malt bottled by Singular Fine & Rare Whiskies, a subdivision of the Glasgow distillery.  Glasgow distillery only released their first single malt in 2018. The source of this independent bottling is undisclosed.  
It has received the following awards: 
International Whisky Competition – GOLDChina Wine & Spirits Awards – SILVER

NAME: Glendronach - 18 Year Old 1991#2512
DESCRIPTION:
A beautiful single cask from the Highland distillery, this dram was distilled in 1991 before being filled into an Oloroso Sherry Butt - Cask #2512. 
Only 760 bottles were ever produced when bottled on 09/2010. 
Bottle number 594.

NAME: Bowmore - 18 Year Old 2001 - 2020 Hand Fill - Sherry Cask #1520
DESCRIPTION:
This 18-Year-Old hand filled bottling from Bowmore Distillery was distilled on 27th November 2001, matured in single sherry cask #1520 and bottled in February 2020 at 56.7%.
 
This is bottle number 6.

NAME: Bowmore - Legend of St Ives
DESCRIPTION:
Islay’s oldest working distillery, Bowmore was established in 1779 and is now regarded as one of the most popular malts not only on Islay, but in the whole of Scotland. The distillery was acquired by Stanley P. Morrison in 1963, ushering in an era of iconic single malts, including the legendary Black Bowmore, credited by many as the genesis of whisky collecting, bottled in 1993. The distillery was bought under the control Suntory the year after they had been stakeholders since 1989), and it remains one of the most collectible brands in Scotch whisky today. Bowmore is one of the few remaining Scottish distilleries to use its own floor maltings, providing them with 40% of their requirements.
The unique microclimate of the No.1 Vaults warehouse at Bowmore distillery means casks share very little with the angels, and has allowed the distillery to bottle some spectacular age-statements over the years. These early Morrison Bowmore era vintages are considered classics, particualrly this parcel of 1964 vintage sherry casks. Indeed, it is hard to fathom where whisky collecting would be today without the Black Bowmore. 
In May 1813 during the war, a French soldier was captured by his British enemies (St Ives).
He actually escaped prison, fought recapture and escaped from his enemies in a hot air balloon.

NAME: Glenmorangie - 15 Year Old - The Artein
DESCRIPTION:
The Highland distillery Glenmorangie produced this 15 Year Old into a series in 2011. Its "stone" in Gaelic and has been named due to its origin being rocky in nature.
 Super Tuscan Wine Casks were used in this expression.

NAME: Ardbeg - 17 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: Ardbeg 17 year old is an increasingly rare bottling, it has been discontinued for a good few years. The first bottling of this sparked the revival of Ardbeg's fortunes after the takeover by Glenmorangie.

NAME: Bunnahabhain - 22 Year Old 1997 - Moine PX Finish
DESCRIPTION:
This limited edition release from Bunnahabhain is a 22-Year-Old single malt expertly aged to develop distinctive flavours.  Distilled in 1997 and matured in warehouse 8 for 22 years, it was bottled in January 2020. This is one of just 1661 numbered bottles.
 
This is bottle number 890.

NAME: Dalmore - Clan Mackenzie Castle Leod
DESCRIPTION:
This lot is for one of the Clan Mackenzie Series bottlings:
A 'significant proportion' of the profits from the original sale of each of these  bottles went to the Mackenzie Clan to help protect their ancestral seat Castle Leo

NAME: Glenmorangie - Burr Oak Reserve - 1993
DESCRIPTION: A rare example of Glenmorangie's skills in wood management, this bottle matured in casks of virgin burr oak from hand selected trees in Missouri. Burr Oak is knotty species tree - taller and slower growing than white oak. Bottled at cask strength of 56.3% ABV.

NAME: Macallan - Sleeping Ice Bucket
DESCRIPTION: "Quiet Please Whisky Sleeping" - A great addition to any Macallan fans collection.

NAME: Bunnahabhain - 22 Year Old 1997 - Moine PX Finish
DESCRIPTION:
This limited edition release from Bunnahabhain is a 22-Year-Old single malt expertly aged to develop distinctive flavours.  Distilled in 1997 and matured in warehouse 8 for 22 years, it was bottled in January 2020. This is one of just 1661 numbered bottles.
 
Bottle 879.

NAME: Caol Ila - 22 Year Old - Fèis Ìle 2019
DESCRIPTION:
This 22-year-old single malt was released by Caol Ila Distillery as their Fèis Ìle 2019 bottling.  It has been fully matured in Sherry-treated American oak hogsheads and bottled at a cask strength of 58.4% abv. The whisky is said to contain ‘fresh mint, citrus, spicy medicinal notes finished with a dominant note of spice’ on the palate.
This is one of 3000 individually numbered bottles.

NAME: Caol Ila - 22 Year Old - Fèis Ìle 2019
DESCRIPTION:
This 22-year-old single malt was released by Caol Ila Distillery as their Fèis Ìle 2019 bottling.  It has been fully matured in Sherry-treated American oak hogsheads and bottled at a cask strength of 58.4% abv. The whisky is said to contain ‘fresh mint, citrus, spicy medicinal notes finished with a dominant note of spice’ on the palate.
This is one of 3000 individually numbered bottles.
This is bottle number 230.

NAME: Craigellachie - 23 Year Old Signature
DESCRIPTION:
Craigellachie goes hand in hand with Speyside. Formerly owned by White Horse (now Diageo) distillers this distillery is now producing its own single malt. 
We owe a lot to this distillery for its contribution to so many blends over the past decades and now it is time to celebrate it as its own single malt.

NAME: Filey Bay - First Release - Yorkshire Single Malt
DESCRIPTION: The first release of Yorkshire's first single malt - ever. Made the Yorkshire way, from field to bottle, with heart and grit.

NAME: Lagavulin - 20 Year Old - Fèis Ìle 2020
DESCRIPTION:
This 20-year-old Lagavulin was matured in a carefully selected mix of refill and PX/Oloroso seasoned casks personally selected by distillery manager Colin Gordon. This Fèis Ìle 2020 edition has been expertly tuned to give its own unique and memorable performance. Bottled at the natural cask strength of 54%. This is one of just 6000 bottles released.
This is bottle number 726.

NAME: Macallan - Edition No.5 ( 3x70cl)
DESCRIPTION: The fifth release in the Edition Series from The Macallan, The Macallan Edition No. 5 celebrates The Macallan’s extensive natural colour spectrum and the intricate whisky-making process, in partnership with masters at the Pantone Color Institute™ to create a unique shade of purple that features on the packaging.

NAME: Nikka - Taketsuru Fortune ‘80
DESCRIPTION:
A blend from Taketsuru in the 1980s which was discontinued in the following decade.
Rarely seen at auction, this blend is originally from Nikka and for the experts among us will deduce that this should have Miyagikyo and Yoichi contained within.

NAME: Macallan - 13 Year Old - 1989 - Cadenhead's
DESCRIPTION:
This cask strength single malt scotch whisky was distilled in Macallan-Glenlivet Distillery and matured in an sherry butt cask for 13 years.
It was bottled by Cadenhead for their Cask Strength Authentic Collection in June 2002, at a natural strength 60.5% ABV.

NAME: Ardbeg - 19 Year Old - Traigh Bhan
DESCRIPTION: Matured in American oak and Oloroso sherry casks – Ardbeg Traigh Bhan is a 19 year old whisky and the Distillery’s latest small batch release. Inspired by Islay’s Traigh Bhan beach (known locally as the Singing Sands), this rare aged spirit is an enchanting reflection of the place to which it gets its name.

NAME: 7 Year Old SMWS 144.1 Searingly Sweet Purple Smoke
DESCRIPTION:
Founded in Edinburgh in 1983 by Phillip 'Pip' Hills comes The Scotch Malt Whisky Society. His passion for whisky started when he was travelling around the country in the 70s. After which, it took his little time to purchase his first cask with a group of friends. Many years later the syndicate was purchased by Glenmorangie PLC.
This Speyside single malt was aged for 7 Years prior to being bottled for the SMWS 144.1 release. It was distilled on the 5th Septemeber 2012 from a Charred New Oak Barrel. There is only 231 bottles.

NAME: Clynelish - 10 Year Old - Hand Filled (Distillery Exclusive)
DESCRIPTION: This is a distillery exclusive, hand filled durring the Highland Whisky Festival 2019. This 10 year old single malt was matured in a first-fill ex-Bourbon American oak hogshead (filled in 2009). The flavours within include warming wood spices, gentle waxiness, orchard fruit and a creamy finish.

NAME: Ardbeg - 19 Year Old - Traigh Bhan
DESCRIPTION: Matured in American oak and Oloroso sherry casks – Ardbeg Traigh Bhan is a 19 year old whisky and the Distillery’s latest small batch release. Inspired by Islay’s Traigh Bhan beach (known locally as the Singing Sands), this rare aged spirit is an enchanting reflection of the place to which it gets its name.

NAME: Ardbeg - 1990 Airigh Nam Beist 2008
DESCRIPTION: Ardbeg 1990 Airigh Nam Beist 2008 - Prior to the Galileo, this is one of the few age statement malts that Ardbeg have been producing. Its name comes from a Gaelic origin which translates to shelter. Distilled in 1990 it was bottled in 2008 at 46% ABV.

NAME: Caroni - 21 Year Old 1996 Velier 100 Imperial Proof
DESCRIPTION:
Caroni was established in 1918 and can be found in the centre of Trinidad's Caroni plains. It is a single estate distillery and possesses its own sugar plant. In the very early days they used a cast iron pot still, which in later years was replaced with a single column style still. Caroni became famous for its very distinctive heavy style of rum.
 A year after the distillery closed in 2004 Italian raconteur Luca Gargano headed to Trinidad and came across the derelict distillery. On a photoshoot he stumbled across a warehouse full of Caroni barrels and in the next few years the barrels were purchased.
 The distillery is now closed but this 100 imperial proof edition was distilled and matured prior to the closure.  It is a blend of 1996 vintage that has been aged for a minimum of 21 years in its home of Trinidad. A huge 86% was lost during this time period but what is left is sublime.

NAME: Tomatin - Verdejo Trilogy (3x 70cl)
DESCRIPTION: The Tomatin Verdejo Cask Trilogy is the result of a partnership between the Tomatin Distillery and the Aberdeen Whisky Shop.  The three releases have been matured in different Verdejo Spanish white wine casks, which is a world first. They were all bottled at cask strength. This lot includes:

NAME: Bowmore - 25 Year Old Small Batch
DESCRIPTION:
Islay’s oldest working distillery, Bowmore was established in 1779 and is now regarded as one of the most popular malts not only on Islay, but in the whole of Scotland. The distillery was acquired by Stanley P. Morrison in 1963, ushering in an era of iconic single malts, including the legendary Black Bowmore, credited by many as the genesis of whisky collecting, bottled in 1993. The distillery was bought under the control Suntory the year after they had been stakeholders since 1989), and it remains one of the most collectible brands in Scotch whisky today. Bowmore is one of the few remaining Scottish distilleries to use its own floor maltings, providing them with 40% of their requirements.
 The unique microclimate of the No.1 Vaults warehouse at Bowmore distillery means casks share very little with the angels, and has allowed the distillery to bottle some spectacular age-statements over the years. These early Morrison Bowmore era vintages are considered classics, particualrly this parcel of 1964 vintage sherry casks. Indeed, it is hard to fathom where whisky collecting would be today without the Black Bowmore. 
This 25-Year-old expression is one from a small batch release and bottled at 43%.

NAME: Ardbeg - 19 Year Old - Traigh Bhan
DESCRIPTION: Matured in American oak and Oloroso sherry casks – Ardbeg Traigh Bhan is a 19 year old whisky and the Distillery’s latest small batch release. Inspired by Islay’s Traigh Bhan beach (known locally as the Singing Sands), this rare aged spirit is an enchanting reflection of the place to which it gets its name.

NAME: Highland Park - Ice & Fire - 2 x 70cl
DESCRIPTION: This lot contains 2 x 70 cl.

NAME: Lagavulin - 18 Year Old - Fèis Ìle 2018
DESCRIPTION:
Available exclusively from the distillery on 26th May 2018, during Feis Ile. Matured for 18 Years, it was then bottled at 53.9% from a combination of refill American oak hogsheads, American oak hogsheads and ex-Bodega European oak butts.
This is bottle number 1422.

NAME: Kilchoman - Still House & Visitor Centre 2020
DESCRIPTION:
A very rare bottling was commissioned to celebrate the opening of the Kilchoman Still House and Visitor Centre on the 21st of Feb 2020. 
A limited release, that was bottled at 54.3% ABV.
Only 220 of these bottles were ever released and it was a combination of fresh bourbon and oloroso sherry casks that had been matured for a minimum of 11 years.

NAME: Aultmore - 25 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: This rarest of Speyside classics has been distilled in handmade copper pot stills since 1897, yet for over a century it was only sold in limited editions aimed at collectors.

NAME: Bruichladdich - 25 Year Old - Black Art 1994 - Edition 7.1
DESCRIPTION:
This seventh incarnation of the now legendary Black Art is as enigmatic as ever, the composition of casks a mystery to all but its creator. Working with the very finest American and French oak to explore that most esoteric relationship between spirit and wood, Black Art 7 is Master Distiller Adam Hannett personal voyage into the heart of Bruichladdich. 
He takes over from the legendary Jim McEwan and what a great job he is doing! 12,000 bottles were released of this expression @ 48.4%.

NAME: Lagavulin - 18 Year Old - Fèis Ìle 2016
DESCRIPTION: This is the Lagavulin Fèis Ìle 2016 release - an 18 year old single malt drawn from European oak ex-bodega Sherry butts and refill American oak hogsheads personally selected by Iain McArthur. 2016 was the year that Lagavulin distillery celebrated their 200th anniversary - as noted on the label of this collectable expression.  This is a limited edition, individually numbered bottle.

NAME: Glenfarclas - 25 Year Old SMWS 1.212 Beeswax on barrels
DESCRIPTION:
Founded in Edinburgh in 1983 by Phillip 'Pip' Hills comes The Scotch Malt Whisky Society. His passion for whisky started when he was travelling around the country in the 70s. After which, it took his little time to purchase his first cask with a group of friends. Many years later the syndicate was purchased by Glenmorangie PLC.
This 25 year old single malt whisky comes from Glenfarclas distillery after being aged in a first fill Ex PX Hogshead. It is one of 194 bottles. SMWS cask No 1.212

NAME: Bruichladdich - Octomore 6.3 - 5 Year Old-  2009 - Islay Barley
DESCRIPTION: Released in 2014, Octomore 06.3 Islay Barley was made with barley grown on Islay from 'Lorgba' field on Octomore Farm.  This limited edition 2009, is true to the character of Bruichladdich's Octomore expressions - it is very heavily peated with 258 PPM.  It is a very flavoursome 5 year old single malt, created with depth, elegance and a tasty dose of peat!

NAME: Ardbeg - Alligator - Untamed Release
DESCRIPTION:
Aged in a similar style to the Ardbeg 10 year old, apart from the fact that a portion of the whisky was aged in heavily charred barrels. The new American White Oak barrels are charred to such an extent that they start to crack a little on the inside, and this resembles alligator skin, thus the name.
The Committee Release of Ardbeg Alligator was exceptional and incredibly popular and so was this Untamed Release...

NAME: Bruichladdich - 23 Year Old - Black Art 1990 - Edition 4.1
DESCRIPTION: This fourth incarnation of the now legendary Black Art is as enigmatic as ever, the composition of casks a mystery to all but its creator. Working with the very finest American and French oak to explore that most esoteric relationship between spirit and wood, Black Art 4 is Master Distiller Jim McEwan’s personal voyage into the heart of Bruichladdich.

NAME: Lagavulin - 18 Year Old - Fèis Ìle 2016
DESCRIPTION: This is the Lagavulin Fèis Ìle 2016 release - an 18 year old single malt drawn from European oak ex-bodega Sherry butts and refill American oak hogsheads personally selected by Iain McArthur. 2016 was the year that Lagavulin distillery celebrated their 200th anniversary - as noted on the label of this collectable expression.  This is a limited edition, individually numbered bottle.

NAME: Glenlivet - Alpha
DESCRIPTION:
Only 3350 bottles were released of this very stunning bottle when it was released in 2013. Only 600 were released in the UK and instead of giving the public the details of their inner liquid, once all of the bottle sold out, the information was released in a video in June 2013 by Alan Winchester.
He tells all and gives away the secret that this dram was entirely matured in ex-Scotch whisky casks.

NAME: Ardbeg - Blaaack 20th Anniversary Committee Release 2020 & Limited Edition Jacket
DESCRIPTION:
Founded in the year 2000, the Ardbeg committee marks the occasion every year with a special release. This release celebrates 20 years of releases with the Ardbeg Blaaack.
This limited edition is feisty and unique in the same breath. Its the first time in the distilleries history that they have used Pinot Noir casks from the country that lies the furthest distance from Islay - New Zealand. 
The legendary have knitted together this special release to give hints of "velvety summer fruit pudding and bitter cherry, with a deeper edge of soot and Ardbeg’s hallmark smoke."
The Grand Whisky Auction is very proud to have this bottling as their bonus bottle in the February auction of 2020.
Sláinte to all the Ardbeg committee members out there!

DESCRIPTION: Ardbeg Supernova has been a super popular - the Committee Release sold out in just a few hours ack in January 2009. This was the peatiest Ardbeg ever at over 100ppm.

NAME: Waterford - Single Farm Origin - Ratheadon 1.1
DESCRIPTION:
Distilled in 2016 and bottled in 2020, this dram has been made purely from Irish barely.
The final release in the series is Ratheadon and is produced from Irina barley grown in Co. Carlow on a rich, loamy soil.

NAME: Waterford - Single Farm Origin - Ratheadon 1.1
DESCRIPTION:
Distilled in 2016 and bottled in 2020, this dram has been made purely from Irish barely.
The final release in the series is Ratheadon and is produced from Irina barley grown in Co. Carlow on a rich, loamy soil.

NAME: Laphroaig - 10 Year Old - Original Cask Strength Batch #004
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is from batch 004, original cask strength bottling of the medicinal 10 year old from Islay's bestselling distillery, Laphroaig.  In making Laphroaig, malted barley is dried over a peat fire.  The smoke from this peat, found only on Islay, gives Laphroaig its particularly rich flavour. This release was bottled at 58.3% in January 2012.

NAME: Glengoyne - 25 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: The Glengoyne 25 year old was introduced in early 2014 as an addition to their core range. The Highlands distillery uses unpeated malt for this whisky, which is then matured exclusively in Sherry casks.

NAME: Ardbeg - Blaaack 20th Anniversary Committee Release 2020 & Limited Edition Jacket
DESCRIPTION:
Founded in the year 2000, the Ardbeg committee marks the occasion every year with a special release. This release celebrates 20 years of releases with the Ardbeg Blaaack.

NAME: Lagavulin - 18 Year Old - Fèis Ìle 2018
DESCRIPTION:
Available exclusively from the distillery on 26th May 2018, during Feis Ile. Matured for 18 Years, it was then bottled at 53.9% from a combination of refill American oak hogsheads, American oak hogsheads and ex-Bodega European oak butts.
This is bottle number 1278.

NAME: Lagavulin - 19 Year Old - Fèis Ìle 2019
DESCRIPTION:
The 2019 Fèis Ìle release from Lagavulin was a 19 year old single malt, matured in three types of casks: refill American oak cask, second Sherry treated American oak cask and a European oak puncheon. 6000 bottles were released.
Colin Gordon, Lagavulin distillery manager, said: ‘This bottle is extra special because it’s been chosen by everyone here – from the visitor centre to the warehouse teams.'
This is bottle number 2888.

NAME: Ardbeg Supernova SN2010
DESCRIPTION:
The second release from Ardbeg comes this Supernova SN 2010.
Heavily peated and equally acclaimed its peat content is over 100ppm.. 
Possibly one of the most recognisable Islay series of malts and a personal favourite of The Grand Whisky Auction.

NAME: Dalmore - Distillery Exclusive 2016 Bourbon Barrels 1997
DESCRIPTION:
Bottled in 2016, this yearly release from the distillery has been matured in Californian Merlot Barrique casks. 
Distilled in 1997 it's said to have a palate resembling spicy pineapple, caramel fudge and Ogen melon.
Bottled at cask strength.

NAME: Ardbeg - Blaaack 20th Anniversary Committee Release 2020 & Limited Edition Jacket
DESCRIPTION:
Founded in the year 2000, the Ardbeg committee marks the occasion every year with a special release. This release celebrates 20 years of releases with the Ardbeg Blaaack.

NAME: Auchentoshan - 22 Year Old - 1996 Old Particular - Halloween Edition
DESCRIPTION:
Distilled on 31st October 1996 and matured for 22 years, this Single Cask from the Auchentoshan Distillery is the first-ever Old Particular Halloween bottling. Bottled at the natural cask strength of 55.4% by Douglas Laing, and without colouring or chill-filtration. 
This is one of just 183 bottles available.

NAME: Hibiki - 12 Year Old (50cl)
DESCRIPTION: This now-discontinued Hibiki 12 year old is a superb blended Japanese whisky meaning it has become a very popular, rare and collectable bottling. Hibiki includes malt whisky from Yamazaki and Hakushu, as well as grain whisky from Chita. The whisky is partly matured in plum liqueur barrels.  Unfortunately, Hibiki 12 was discontinued by Suntory in 2015.

NAME: Bruichladdich - 21 Year Old Cuvee #407 PX Finish
DESCRIPTION: This is one of the three initial releases in Bruichladdich's Cuvee range. Cuvee 407 is simply named PX and is subtitled 'La Noche Bocca Arriba', the title of a short story by Julio Cortázar.  It is a 21 year old single malt, matured in American oak and then finished in Pedro Ximenez casks.

NAME: Macallan - 18 Year Old - Double Cask 2020
DESCRIPTION:
This 18 Year Old Macallan was matured in a combination of American and European Sherry oak for a minimum of 18 years. It is part of the Macallan Double Cask range, which marries the classic Macallan style and the sweetness of American oak. 
Seen as the finest cut, one of The Macallan's Six Pillars has inspired this distinctive expression. These pillars are the unique foundation stones that combine to create the renowned quality and character of The Macallan.

NAME: Ardbeg - Blaaack 20th Anniversary Committee Release 2020 & Limited Edition Jacket
DESCRIPTION:
Founded in the year 2000, the Ardbeg committee marks the occasion every year with a special release. This release celebrates 20 years of releases with the Ardbeg Blaaack.

Working with the very finest American and French oak to explore that most esoteric relationship between spirit and wood, Black Art 7 is Master Distiller Adam Hannett personal voyage into the heart of Bruichladdich.

NAME: Vega - North Star 41 Year Old 1976
DESCRIPTION:
This 41 year old limited edition blended malt is produced by North Star Spirits.
The magic behind this bottle began in November 1976 when the whiskies used in this expression were distilled.
Bottled in 2008 it is one of 400 bottles which were bottled at cask strength.

NAME: Bruichladdich - High Noon Fèis Ìle 2015 (50cl)
DESCRIPTION:
Bruichladdich specifically released 1,881 bottles of High Noon to align with their official date of establishment in 1881. This is the last Feis Ile bottling from Jim McEwan before his retirement in July 2015. It is a culmination of his Black Arts journey - it is said that the combined age of the casks used is 134 years.
This bottle has been signed by Jim McEwan, Head Distiller, Bruichladdich.
This is bottle number 465/1881.

NAME: Highland Park - 12 Year Old 2003 Single Cask  #5878 Braunstein & Friends
DESCRIPTION:
This bottling was limited to 648 bottles and aged for 12 years in a single cask.
Highland Park bottled cask #5878 especially for Braunstein & Friends in 2016.
It was a 1st fill European sherry butt and was distilled back in 2003.

NAME: Lagavulin - 16 Year Old - White Horse
DESCRIPTION:
This is a popular and much sought-after single malt with the massive peat-smoke that's typical of southern Islay - but also offering richness and a dryness that turns it into a truly interesting tipple. The 16 year old, aged in oak casks has truly become a benchmark Islay dram from the Lagavulin distillery.
This whisky was The Runner Up in TWE's Whisky of the Year 2014 & 2015 Silver Outstanding Medal Winner - International Wine & Spirits Competition amongst other accolades. 
White Horse Edition is very appealing to collectors and is fast disappearing.

NAME: Old Pulteney - 26 Year Old - 1990 Vintage
DESCRIPTION:
A Highland classic small batch single malt from Old Pulteney.
Distilled in 1990, this dram was matured in American and Spanish Oak and was finished in casks which previously held heavily peated whisky.
A limited-edition, 26-year-old bottling.

NAME: Highland Park - 12 Year Old 2003 Single Cask  #5878 Braunstein & Friends
DESCRIPTION:
This bottling was limited to 648 bottles and aged for 12 years in a single cask.
Highland Park bottled cask #5878 especially for Braunstein & Friends in 2016.
It was a 1st fill European sherry butt and was distilled back in 2003.

NAME: ChiChibu - On The Way - 2019
DESCRIPTION:
The 'On The Way' series by Chichibu charts the fledgeling distillery's progress over the years.  This is the 2019 release of Chichibu On The Way.  It is a multi-vintage vatting of whisky distilled from when they opened in 2008, including some of their oldest whiskies which has been matured in bourbon casks then finished in Mizunara casks.  This bottling is already very popular with Japanese whisky enthusiasts as it showcases the skill of distiller Ichiro Akuto and his team.
This is bottle number 8408.

NAME: Highland Park - 12 Year Old 2003 Single Cask  #5878 Braunstein & Friends
DESCRIPTION:
This bottling was limited to 648 bottles and aged for 12 years in a single cask.
Highland Park bottled cask #5878 especially for Braunstein & Friends in 2016.
It was a 1st fill European sherry butt and was distilled back in 2003.

NAME: Bunnahabhain - 25 Year Old
DESCRIPTION:
1883 production started creating mostly lightly peated malts. 
Twenty five years have been sent maturing in order to create different layers within this single malt.
The Margadale spring is said to create Bunnahabhains unique character.

NAME: Ballantine's - 30 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: This 30-year-old is an excellent blend by Ballantines and is well recognised as an outstanding whisky. It won a Gold at the International Spirits Challenge and an ISC Trophy (the second in four years), was named as Category Champion for Blended Scotch Whisky and Jim Murray gave it 92 points.

NAME: ChiChibu - On The Way - 2019
DESCRIPTION: The 'On The Way' series by Chichibu charts the fledgeling distillery's progress over the years.  This is the 2019 release of Chichibu On The Way.  It is a multi-vintage vatting of whisky distilled from when they opened in 2008, including some of their oldest whiskies which has been matured in bourbon casks then finished in Mizunara casks.  This bottling is already very popular with Japanese whisky enthusiasts as it showcases the skill of distiller Ichiro Akuto and his team.

NAME: Laphroaig - 10 Year Old - 1994 Royal Warrant
DESCRIPTION: This is a special bottling of Laphroaig 10-year-old, released in 1994 to celebrate a Royal Warrant being granted to the distillery by His Royal Highness Prince Charles.  Every bottle since has featured the Coat of Arms of HRH.  This is a limited edition of 2200 bottles.

NAME: Highland Park - 12 Year Old 2003 Single Cask  #5878 Braunstein & Friends
DESCRIPTION:
This bottling was limited to 648 bottles and aged for 12 years in a single cask.
Highland Park bottled cask #5878 especially for Braunstein & Friends in 2016.
It was a 1st fill European sherry butt and was distilled back in 2003.

NAME: Bruichladdich - 1992 Valinch - Wimbledon Winner 2013
DESCRIPTION:
Bottled to celebrate Andy Murray becoming the Mens Singles Champion at Wimbledon in 2013.  This distillery exclusive valinch is a 21-year-old from single cask #010.  This is one of 430 bottles.
This is bottle number 89 and is signed.

NAME: Highland Park - Capella Special Edition
DESCRIPTION:
Highland Park Capella was released in 2002. It marks the 60th anniversary of one of the most famous landmarks on the island  - The Italian Chapel.
This is 1 of only 5,400 produced from the Northernmost Scotch Whisky Distillery in the world.

NAME: ChiChibu - On The Way - 2019
DESCRIPTION: The 'On The Way' series by Chichibu charts the fledgeling distillery's progress over the years.  This is the 2019 release of Chichibu On The Way.  It is a multi-vintage vatting of whisky distilled from when they opened in 2008, including some of their oldest whiskies which has been matured in bourbon casks then finished in Mizunara casks.  This bottling is already very popular with Japanese whisky enthusiasts as it showcases the skill of distiller Ichiro Akuto and his team.

NAME: Ardbeg - Blaaack 20th Anniversary Committee Release 2020 & Limited Edition Jacket
DESCRIPTION:
Founded in the year 2000, the Ardbeg committee marks the occasion every year with a special release. This release celebrates 20 years of releases with the Ardbeg Blaaack.
This limited edition is feisty and unique in the same breath. Its the first time in the distilleries history that they have used Pinot Noir casks from the country that lies the furthest distance from Islay - New Zealand. 
The legendary have knitted together this special release to give hints of "velvety summer fruit pudding and bitter cherry, with a deeper edge of soot and Ardbeg’s hallmark smoke."
The Grand Whisky Auction is very proud to have this bottling as their bonus bottle in the February auction of 2020.
Sláinte to all the Ardbeg committee members out there!

NAME: Kilchoman - Still House & Visitor Centre 2020
DESCRIPTION:
A very rare bottling was commissioned to celebrate the opening of the Kilchoman Still House and Visitor Centre on the 21st of Feb 2020. 
A limited release, that was bottled at 54.3% ABV.
Only 220 of these bottles were ever released and it was a combination of fresh bourbon and oloroso sherry casks that had been matured for a minimum of 11 years.

NAME: Old Pulteney - 1982 Sherry Wood Cask 15 Year Old #928
DESCRIPTION:
An Old Pulteney single cask from the Highlands of Scotland that was distilled in December 1982 and matured for 15 years in a sherry cask #928. 
The bottle is number 354

NAME: Daftmill - Summer Batch - 2006 USA
DESCRIPTION:
Daftmill Summer Batch distilled in 2006 and bottled in 2019 for the US market. 
Daftmill is grown, distilled, matured and bottled in the Kingdom of Fife.
Only 1680 bottles have been produced by the Cuthbert family. When not distilling Francis Cuthbert looks after the estate, growing the malting barley used to make this beautiful malt. 
This bottling is made from 7 different first fill bourbon casks - 067/2006, 068/2007, 069/2006, 070/2006, 071/2006, 072/2006, 073/2006.

NAME: Dalwhinnie - 1987 25 Year Old 2012 Release
DESCRIPTION: There were 5358 bottles of this 25 year old single malt from Dalwhinnie produced. Distilled in 1987 it was eventually bottled in 2012. Matured in American Oak casks, Dalwhinnie is one of the highest distilleries in Scotland. It sits at 1164 ft above sea level. Dalwhinnie is used as the signature malt in Buchanan's blend.

NAME: Lagavulin - 16 Year Old - White Horse
DESCRIPTION:
This is a popular and much sought-after single malt with the massive peat-smoke that's typical of southern Islay - but also offering richness and a dryness that turns it into a truly interesting tipple. The 16 year old, aged in oak casks has truly become a benchmark Islay dram from the Lagavulin distillery.
This whisky was The Runner Up in TWE's Whisky of the Year 2014 & 2015 Silver Outstanding Medal Winner - International Wine & Spirits Competition amongst other accolades. 
White Horse Edition is very appealing to collectors and is fast disappearing.

NAME: Octomore - Concept 0.2 - X4+10
DESCRIPTION: This is the second release from the Concept series, this bottle was quadruple distilled before being bottled at 10 years old at 70% ABV. The X4+10 is a super-heavily peated whisky. Peated to 162ppm. This is a 50cl bottling.

NAME: GlenDronach - 15 Year Old - Sherry Oak
DESCRIPTION: 100% matured in sherry casks this 15 Year Old from GlenDronach was very popular in the 1990's before Billy Walker took over the distillery.

NAME: Highland Park - 12 Year Old 2003 Single Cask  #5878 Braunstein & Friends
DESCRIPTION:
This bottling was limited to 648 bottles and aged for 12 years in a single cask.
Highland Park bottled cask #5878 especially for Braunstein & Friends in 2016.
It was a 1st fill European sherry butt and was distilled back in 2003.

NAME: Highland Park - 13 Year Old - Single Cask #6367 - SMWS & VYS
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was bottled exclusively for Whisky Clubs of Finland, SMWS & VYS.  Distilled in 2002, this single malt was matured for 13 years in 1st fill European sherry hogshead #6376 at the cask strength of 59.2% ABV.  With only 306 bottles available, this is a limited edition.

NAME: Arran - Harmony Edition Vol.2 2019 Malt and Music Festival
DESCRIPTION: One of only 1000 bottles produced this is the 2019 release for the Malt and Music festival on Arran. It so great to see distilling happening on the island again after there was virtually no activity in the 19th and 20th centuries. The revived distillery was opened in 1995 and bottled their first single malt in 1998.

NAME: Highland Park - 12 Year Old (Old Style) 3L
DESCRIPTION:
Highland Park 12 year old - one of the best malts in the world year on year. This bottling has been in its core range for over 100 years. This design of bottle was used by Highland Park from 1999-early 2000s.
This classic 1990s bottling was said to be whisky author Michael Jackson’s favourite tipple.
From records and according to a local, this is one of only 3 bottles produced. One has since been used to launch a ship.

NAME: Caol Ila - 2000 Feis Ile 2011 #301696
DESCRIPTION:
Released for the annual festival on Islay, Feis Ile, in 2011, this Caol Ila was selected by Billy Stitchell.  Distilled on the 8th February 2000, this beauty was matured in Bodega sherry cask #301696.
 
This is bottle number 136.

NAME: Highland Park - 16 Year Old Odin
DESCRIPTION:
This stunning bottle is the fourth and final part of Highland Park's Valhalla collection that follows on from Thor, Loki and Freya.
'The Furious One' has been described as a rich and dark whisky with the distillery's trademark sweet and gently peaty character.  
It has been aged for 16 years in a combination of first fill sherry and refill hogshead casks.  This is one of 17,000 bottles produced.

NAME: Inchgower - 27 Year Old Limited Release
DESCRIPTION:
A limited release from Inchgower, it was distilled in 1990 and bottled at 27 years ol at cask strength at 55.3% ABV.
There is 8544 bottles.
This is bottle number 1972.

NAME: Ardbeg - Blaaack 20th Anniversary Committee Release 2020
DESCRIPTION:
Founded in the year 2000, the Ardbeg committee marks the occasion every year with a special release. This release celebrates 20 years of releases with the Ardbeg Blaaack.
This limited edition is feisty and unique in the same breath. Its the first time in the distilleries history that they have used Pinot Noir casks from the country that lies the furthest distance from Islay - New Zealand.

The Grand Whisky Auction is very proud to have this bottling as their bonus bottle in the February auction of 2020.
Sláinte to all the Ardbeg committee members out there!

NAME: Ardbeg - Kildalton (2014)
DESCRIPTION:
Ardbeg Kildalton is a limited release that celebrates the ancient Celtic Kildaton Cross on Islay, which is 1200 years old.  This cross is only 5 miles away from the Ardbeg distillery and is steeped with history.
Kildaton was matured in ex-bourbon and ex-Sherry casks and bottled at 46% ABV with no chill-filtration.  This bottle was only sold at the distillery in 2014 and comes with a stunning lined presentation box.

NAME: Daftmill - Summer Batch - 2006 USA
DESCRIPTION:
Daftmill Summer Batch distilled in 2006 and bottled in 2019 for the US market. 
Daftmill is grown, distilled, matured and bottled in the Kingdom of Fife.
Only 1680 bottles have been produced by the Cuthbert family. When not distilling Francis Cuthbert looks after the estate, growing the malting barley used to make this beautiful malt. 
This bottling is made from 7 different first fill bourbon casks - 067/2006, 068/2007, 069/2006, 070/2006, 071/2006, 072/2006, 073/2006.

NAME: Miyagikyo - Sherry Wood Finish 2018
DESCRIPTION:
This limited edition Miyagikyo sherry wood finished single malt was released in 2018. 
Miyagikyo distillery produces a refined malt whisky with a signature fruity and floral freshness.

NAME: Caol Ila - 15 Year Old Flora and Fauna Boxed
DESCRIPTION:
By far one of the most sought after Flora and Fauna bottlings.
This Caol Ila 15 year old has been discontinued for some time now and this is starting to show in the value of the bottle increasing over time.
Caol Ila is, of course, the only Islay bottle in the collection which helps add to how rare it is.

NAME: Nikka from the Barrel - Miyagikyo Distillery Label
DESCRIPTION:
Nikka From the Barrel is a blend from The Nikka Whisky Distilling Co.  Matured malt grain whiskies from the Miyagikyo and Yoichi distilleries have been blended and re-casked.
This special edition has a Miyagikyo exclusive label and could only be bought locally in the distillery shop.

NAME: Big Peat - The Purim Edition 2018
DESCRIPTION:
This is the Purim Edition 2018 and was bottled exclusively for the Israeli market, with Peat dressed as King Ahasuerus. 
Purim is a Jewish holiday that celebrates the saving of the Jewish people from Haman, who was planning to massacre them on the 14th day of Adar.

NAME: Octomore - Concept 0.2 - X4+10
DESCRIPTION: This is the second release from the Concept series, this bottle was quadruple distilled before being bottled at 10 years old at 70% ABV. The X4+10 is a super-heavily peated whisky. Peated to 162ppm. This is a 50cl bottling.

NAME: Aberfeldy - 25 Year Old
DESCRIPTION:
From the eastern highlands, this award-winning malt was pretty much removed from everyone's thoughts, that was until it was bought over by Bacardi. Aberfeldy has a highly rated visitor centre which opened at the turn of the millennium and attracts over thirty thousand visitors a year.
 
This 25 year old was matured in specially selected oak casks.

NAME: Johnnie Walker - The Directors Blend 2005
DESCRIPTION: Johnnie Walker Directors Blends were exclusively given to Diageo executives and as such, they are the one of the rarest and most sought after Johnnie Walker bottlings.  This is the very first release from 2005. The Directors Blends are very hard to find series that are stunning addition to any collection.

NAME: Ardbeg - Blaaack 20th Anniversary Committee Release 2020
DESCRIPTION:
Founded in the year 2000, the Ardbeg committee marks the occasion every year with a special release. This release celebrates 20 years of releases with the Ardbeg Blaaack.
This limited edition is feisty and unique in the same breath. Its the first time in the distilleries history that they have used Pinot Noir casks from the country that lies the furthest distance from Islay - New Zealand. 
The legendary have knitted together this special release to give hints of "velvety summer fruit pudding and bitter cherry, with a deeper edge of soot and Ardbeg’s hallmark smoke."
The Grand Whisky Auction is very proud to have this bottling as their bonus bottle in the February auction of 2020.
Sláinte to all the Ardbeg committee members out there!

NAME: Ardbeg - Blaaack 20th Anniversary Committee Release 2020
DESCRIPTION:
Founded in the year 2000, the Ardbeg committee marks the occasion every year with a special release. This release celebrates 20 years of releases with the Ardbeg Blaaack.
This limited edition is feisty and unique in the same breath. Its the first time in the distilleries history that they have used Pinot Noir casks from the country that lies the furthest distance from Islay - New Zealand. 
The legendary have knitted together this special release to give hints of "velvety summer fruit pudding and bitter cherry, with a deeper edge of soot and Ardbeg’s hallmark smoke."
The Grand Whisky Auction is very proud to have this bottling as their bonus bottle in the February auction of 2020.
Sláinte to all the Ardbeg committee members out there!

NAME: Ron Zacapa - 30th Anniversary - Rum
DESCRIPTION: This bottling of Zacapa Centenario was released to commemorate the 30th Anniversary of its first release. It comes with two specially-designed Reidel crystal glasses unique to Zacapa.

NAME: Springbank - 14 Year Old - SMWS 27.108 - A Savoury Experience!
DESCRIPTION:
Founded in Edinburgh in 1983 by Phillip 'Pip' Hills comes The Scotch Malt Whisky Society. His passion for whisky started when he was travelling around the country in the 70s. After which, it took his little time to purchase his first cask with a group of friends. Many years later the syndicate was purchased by Glenmorangie PLC.
From the Campbeltown region of Scotland, this single malt was distilled at Springbank and matured for 14 years after being distilled on 31st March 2000 in a refill barrel & ex bourbon cask. One of only 174 bottles.

NAME: Glenrothes - 1985 (Bottled in 1997)
DESCRIPTION: A vintage expression from Glenrothes, distilled in 1985 and bottled in 1997. A hugely popular bottle - all over the world, from this Speyside distillery.

NAME: Ardbeg - Supernova - 2015 Committee Release
DESCRIPTION:
Ardbeg Supernova SN2015 is the final release of a 4 part series.
The story of this bottle is quite incredible, Ardbeg successfully launched whisky into space and believe it or not...it returned.
At over 100 PPM peated you could certainly say this whisky hits the pallet with a big bang!

NAME: Laphroaig - 10 Year Old - 1994 Royal Warrant
DESCRIPTION: This is a special bottling of Laphroaig 10-year-old, released in 1994 to celebrate a Royal Warrant being granted to the distillery by His Royal Highness Prince Charles.  Every bottle since has featured the Coat of Arms of HRH.  This is a limited edition of 2200 bottles.

NAME: Highland Park - 16 Year Old Odin
DESCRIPTION:
This stunning bottle is the fourth and final part of Highland Park's Valhalla collection that follows on from Thor, Loki and Freya.
'The Furious One' has been described as a rich and dark whisky with the distillery's trademark sweet and gently peaty character.  
It has been aged for 16 years in a combination of first fill sherry and refill hogshead casks.  This is one of 17,000 bottles produced.

NAME: Bimber - Oloroso Sherry Butt #544-7/67 - Selfridges Exclusive
DESCRIPTION:
An exclusive partnership between the London distillery and department store Selfridges. This Bimber was made from single farm barley (which was malted at Westminster Maltings) and matured in four 1st fill American Oak Ex-bourbon casks. It was then finished in a single Oloroso sherry butt from hugely renowned Spanish sherry producer González Byass. Bottled in June 2020 at 51.5% ABV.
Only 937 bottles were produced from Cask #544-7/67. Each tube which cases the bottles has artwork from the Dutch artist and sculptor Eelke van Willegen.
This is bottle number 304.

NAME: Macallan - Rare Cask No. 1 - 2018
DESCRIPTION: The Macallan Rare Cask Batch No.1, 2018 release introduced a new look for Rare Cask which has been rebranded and revised.  It is an attempt by Macallan to give greater insight into their whisky making process.  This first batch was one of three batches to be released in 2018, with further batches planned for subsequent years. Each limited release batch represents the volume of only 50 oak sherry butts.

NAME: Macallan - Estate Reserve - 2019
DESCRIPTION:
The Macallan Estate Reserve 2019 forms part of The 1824 Collection. It is a classic style of Macallan that includes a parcel of specially selected casks to deliver great richness and intensity.
All of the whisky used was grown locally on the Macallan estate.  The whisky is distilled just once a year, over the course of a single week. The single malt was then matured exclusively in sherry seasoned butts and hogsheads.

NAME: Macallan - Estate Reserve - 1824 Collection
DESCRIPTION: The Macallan Estate Reserve forms part of The Macallan 1824 Collection and is a classic style of Macallan that includes a parcel of specially selected casks to deliver great richness and intensity.

NAME: Talisker - 10 Year Old - Map Label
DESCRIPTION: An older release of 10 Year Old from Talisker distillery on the Isle of Skye.  Aged for a minimum of 10 years in American oak casks. The bottle label and the box feature a map of Skye.

NAME: Ardbeg - Uigeadail 2008
DESCRIPTION: Bottled at the cask strength of 54.2%, this limited edition Ardbeg was created from a marriage of single malt from bourbon barrels and sherry butts.  This gives a sweet and smoky finish.  It is named after the Loch that all the Ardbeg water flows from.  This Ardbeg is often said to be the best value in the Ardbeg core range, following the demise of Airigh nam Beist.

NAME: Macallan - Rare Cask No. 1 - 2018
DESCRIPTION: The Macallan Rare Cask Batch No.1, 2018 release introduced a new look for Rare Cask which has been rebranded and revised.  It is an attempt by Macallan to give greater insight into their whisky making process.  This first batch was one of three batches to be released in 2018, with further batches planned for subsequent years. Each limited release batch represents the volume of only 50 oak sherry butts.

NAME: Ardbeg - Galileo
DESCRIPTION: Ardbeg Galileo was one of 2012's most eagerly awaited releases.  It is made up from casks distilled in 1999, some of which spent their full term of maturation in casks that previously held Marsala wine.  This gives sweet tropical fruit flavours to the malt.  Galileo's concept is in celebration of the well-publicised experiment whereby small quantities of Ardbeg were sent into space at the end of 2011 to see how they mature in zero gravity.

NAME: Daftmill - 2007 Winter Batch
DESCRIPTION:
A family-owned and operated distillery which is located in the heart of the kingdom of Fife.
This limited edition is one of only 1785 bottles which was distilled in 2007. The seven first-fill ex-bourbon barrels that make up this release are: 023/2007, 024/2007, 025/2007, 027/2007, 032/2007, 035/2007 and 038/2007 which were all distilled and filled in November 2007. This release was bottled in 2019.
When not distilling Francis Cuthbert looks after the estate, growing and malting the barley.

NAME: Highland Park - 15 Year Old - Single Cask #3249 - Nor'Easter 75cl
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was bottled exclusively for Northeast United States - Nor'Easter.  Distilled in 2002, this single malt was matured for 15 years in refill butt #3249 at the cask strength of 56.9% ABV.  With only 546 b

NAME: Mannochmore - 10 Year Old - 2018 Manager's Dram
DESCRIPTION:
Mannochmore 2018 Manager's Dram is highly sought after for most collectors as the series goes on, year on year.
Bottled at it's natural strength of 58% this was specially selected by Annelise Hastings.
This is bottle number 1278.

NAME: Strathisla - 15 Year Old - 1991 Cask Strength Batch #4
DESCRIPTION:
Originally released exclusively for sale at Chivas distilleries, this cask-strength bottle of Strathisla was distilled in 1991 and bottled in 2006 at 15 years old.
This is a limited bottling from batch No SI 15 004.

NAME: Ardbeg - Galileo
DESCRIPTION: Ardbeg Galileo was one of 2012's most eagerly awaited releases.  It is made up from casks distilled in 1999, some of which spent their full term of maturation in casks that previously held Marsala wine.  This gives sweet tropical fruit flavours to the malt.  Galileo's concept is in celebration of the well-publicised experiment whereby small quantities of Ardbeg were sent into space at the end of 2011 to see how they mature in zero gravity.

NAME: Lagavulin - Islay Jazz Festival 2015
DESCRIPTION:
A special release for the Lagavulin 2015 Jazz Festival. This bottling is a vatting of refill American Oak Casks and European Oak Bodega Casks.  This was a limited edition release of individually numbered bottles bottled at the cask strength of 55.4%.
This is bottle number 1252.

NAME: Ardbeg - 1998 Renaissance
DESCRIPTION:
Ardbeg Renaissance is the end of the 4 part series that began with the 'Very Young.' 
Renaissance is the first 10-year old Ardbeg that is entirely comprised of spirit produced after Glenmorangie's takeover of the distillery in 1997. Bottled in 2008, this 
A fitting end to the series.

NAME: Bunnahabhain - 2001 - Sauternes Finish - Fèis Ìle 2019
DESCRIPTION: This limited edition single malt from Bunnahabhain Distillery has been matured for 17 years.  For the last 5 years, the whisky was finished in Sauternes hogsheads. This release is one of 3 by Bunnahabhain for Fèis Ìle 2019. It has been bottled at 54.2% ABV. This is one of only 1118 bottles produced.

NAME: Highland Park - 13 Year Old cask #5424 Duty Zero Hong Kong
DESCRIPTION:
Highland Park is known for being the most Northern Scotch Whisky Distillery in the world. It is situated on the outskirts of the biggest town in Orkney 58.9847°N. It is so far North it is almost in the Arctic circle. To give you an idea, it is on the same latitude as Anchorage, Alaska.
The distillery has been distilling in the same site since 1798 where the founder, Magnus Eunson’s, original illicit still was at High Park.
They smoke their own barley from over 4,000 year old peat which has been cut from the Hobbister Moor only seven miles from the distillery.
Distilled in 2004 and bottled in 2018 from refill butt #5424. It has been bottled exclusively for Duty Zero in Hong Kong.

NAME: Arran - Harmony Edition Vol.3 2020 Malt and Music Festival
DESCRIPTION:
One of only 1000 bottles produced this is the 2020 release for the Malt and Music festival on Arran. It so great to see distilling happening on the island again after there was virtually no activity in the 19th and 20th centuries. The revived distillery was opened in 1995 and bottled their first single malt in 1998.
This expression was aged in three different casks:
Sherry Hogshead, French Puncheon & Bourbon Barrel.

NAME: Port Charlotte - 14 Year Old 2003 Valinch - Sauternes Cask
DESCRIPTION: From Bruichladdich, one of the first Port Charlotte Valinch released after the 2018 rebranding. This single cask 14-year-old was distilled in Islay in 2003, matured in Sauternes cask #13/267-10.  This is a distillery exclusive release of 423 bottles at 55.8% ABV.  This is a 50cl bottling.

NAME: Dallas Dhu - 1980 - Gordon & MacPhail
DESCRIPTION: Distilled in 1980 this Dallas Dhu is a special Speyside single malt Scotch whisky, that was bottled in 2000 by Gordon & MacPhail.  Matured in a refill puncheon, this is a rare expression from a lost distillery.

NAME: Tomatin - Cù Bòcan - 1989
DESCRIPTION:
Named after the mythical creature that stalked Tomatin villagers for centuries. A limited-edition expression of Cù Bòcan.
This 1989 cask strength came from casks 37470, 37471 & 37472 which had been lurking quietly in the warehouse since the rare production of peated whisky in 1988 took place. The best has been released to create this rare edition.
 
This is bottle number 754.

NAME: Macallan - Rare Cask No. 1 - 2019
DESCRIPTION: The Macallan Rare Cask Batch No.1, 2018 release introduced a new look for Rare Cask which has been rebranded and revised.  It is an attempt by Macallan to give greater insight into their whisky making process.  This first batch was one of three batches to be released in 2018, with further batches planned for subsequent years. Each limited release batch represents the volume of only 50 oak sherry butts.

NAME: Macallan - Edition No.3
DESCRIPTION:
The third release in the Macallan Edition series.  A unique selection of oak cask styles are combined to yield a new limited edition expression each year.  
Edition No.3 was a collaboration between master perfumer Roja Dove and master whisky maker Bob Dalgarno.  With Dove's remarkable sensory knowledge, Dalgarno shaped the character of Edition No.3 from a combination of European and American oak casks to create a deliciously sweet, single malt with floral notes.

NAME: Glenfiddich - Winter Storm #3 Batch 2
DESCRIPTION: This is the third release in Glenfiddich's Experimental Series by Malt Master Brian Kinsman and the first to be a limited batch release.  This 21 year old Glenfiddich has been finished in an ice wine cask from Peller Estate in Niagra, Canada.

NAME: Glenfiddich - 23 Year Old Grand Cru
DESCRIPTION:
The Glenfiddich range has a new member, Grand Cru.
'The ultimate spirit of celebration' was released on general sale at the distillery in 2019 and has been matured for 23 years in American and European oak casks.
The finishing touch is the expression being finished in French cuvée casks.

NAME: Highland Park - 21 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: 21 Year Old Highland Park is considered one of the best expressions Highland Park produces by many.  Originally created exclusively for global travel retail and duty-free markets, this whisky was named Best Single Malt of the Year at the World Whisky Awards 2009. Released in October 2007, Highland Park 21 is a full-flavoured, powerful, sweet single malt with a rich smoky finish.

NAME: Macallan - Estate Reserve - 2019
DESCRIPTION:
The Macallan Estate Reserve 2019 forms part of The 1824 Collection. It is a classic style of Macallan that includes a parcel of specially selected casks to deliver great richness and intensity.
All of the whisky used was grown locally on the Macallan estate.  The whisky is distilled just once a year, over the course of a single week. The single malt was then matured exclusively in sherry seasoned butts and hogsheads.

NAME: Macallan - Estate Reserve - 2019
DESCRIPTION:
The Macallan Estate Reserve 2019 forms part of The 1824 Collection. It is a classic style of Macallan that includes a parcel of specially selected casks to deliver great richness and intensity.
All of the whisky used was grown locally on the Macallan estate.  The whisky is distilled just once a year, over the course of a single week. The single malt was then matured exclusively in sherry seasoned butts and hogsheads.

NAME: Bowmore - 17 Year Old Warehousemen's Selection Distillery Exclusive
DESCRIPTION:
Only available from one of the most iconic Islands in Scotland, Islay. This is the last in the craftsmen collection. It was distilled on the 14th of June 1999 and bottled 17 years later, 3000 bottles were produced from a mixture of Bourbon, Sherry and Wine Casks.
This bottle is number nine of three thousand.

NAME: Macallan - Edition No.3
DESCRIPTION:
The third release in the Macallan Edition series.  A unique selection of oak cask styles are combined to yield a new limited edition expression each year.  
Edition No.3 was a collaboration between master perfumer Roja Dove and master whisky maker Bob Dalgarno.  With Dove's remarkable sensory knowledge, Dalgarno shaped the character of Edition No.3 from a combination of European and American oak casks to create a deliciously sweet, single malt with floral notes.

NAME: Bunnahabhain - 2002 - Maderia Finish - Fèis Ìle 2020
DESCRIPTION:
This limited edition single malt from Bunnahabhain Distillery was matured for 14 years in classic bourbon barrels, then finished in Maderia casks for another three years.  Bottled at 53%, and released by Bunnahabhain for the 25th anniversary of Fèis Ìle - Fèis Ìle 2020.  This is one of only 1164 bottles produced.
This is bottle number 1066.

NAME: Macallan - Edition No.3
DESCRIPTION:
The third release in the Macallan Edition series.  A unique selection of oak cask styles are combined to yield a new limited edition expression each year.  
Edition No.3 was a collaboration between master perfumer Roja Dove and master whisky maker Bob Dalgarno.  With Dove's remarkable sensory knowledge, Dalgarno shaped the character of Edition No.3 from a combination of European and American oak casks to create a deliciously sweet, single malt with floral notes.

NAME: Macallan - Edition No.3
DESCRIPTION:
The third release in the Macallan Edition series.  A unique selection of oak cask styles are combined to yield a new limited edition expression each year.  
Edition No.3 was a collaboration between master perfumer Roja Dove and master whisky maker Bob Dalgarno.  With Dove's remarkable sensory knowledge, Dalgarno shaped the character of Edition No.3 from a combination of European and American oak casks to create a deliciously sweet, single malt with floral notes.

NAME: Macallan - Edition No.3
DESCRIPTION:
The third release in the Macallan Edition series.  A unique selection of oak cask styles are combined to yield a new limited edition expression each year.  
Edition No.3 was a collaboration between master perfumer Roja Dove and master whisky maker Bob Dalgarno.  With Dove's remarkable sensory knowledge, Dalgarno shaped the character of Edition No.3 from a combination of European and American oak casks to create a deliciously sweet, single malt with floral notes.

NAME: Balvenie - 21 Year Old Madeira Cask Finish
DESCRIPTION: This was a travel retail release in 2016 from the Speyside distillery, Balvenie. The Maderia cask finish was matured for 20 years in traditional oak casks before being transferred into casks that matured fortified Maderia wine.

NAME: Highland Park - 13 Year Old - Single Cask #5875 - Vinothek Massen Luxembourg
